Category.Caption: Appearance
Category.DialogHelp: These options allow you to customize the look of SlickEdit. You can change fonts and colors, specify which toolbars and tool windows to display, and enable display of special characters.

Boolean.Caption: Horizontal scroll bar
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, each editor window displays a horizontal scroll bar.

Boolean.Caption: Vertical scroll bar
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, each editor window displays a vertical scroll bar.

Numeric.Caption: Window left margin
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of space, in inches, between the left edge of the window and the editor text. This option has no effect when there are bitmaps displayed in the left margin, since more space may be necessary to accommodate the size of the bitmap.

Select.Caption: Cursor style
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the style of the cursor (block/text mode style, or vertical).

Numeric.Caption: Cursor blink period (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the period of cursor blinks in milliseconds. Set this value to 0 to use the OS-default.

Boolean.Caption: Hide mouse pointer
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the mouse pointer is hidden when typing, but visible when moving the mouse or when a dialog box is displayed.

Numeric.Caption: Vertical line column
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the column in which the editor is to display a vertical line. When the value is set to 0, the vertical line is not displayed. The vertical line is not displayed when using proportional fonts, as in Unicode files.

Color.Caption: Vertical line color
Color.DialogHelp: Specifies the color of the vertical line when it is displayed.

Boolean.Caption: Top of file line
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a line 0 is inserted at the top of each buffer with the text "Top of File". This doesn't affect lines of code.

Boolean.Caption: List command line completions
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a pop-up list of possible commands and argument completions is displayed for partially typed commands and arguments on the SlickEdit command line.

Boolean.Caption: Change directory
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the current directory is changed in the editor when the directory is changed in the Change Directory dialog (File > Change Directory) and the Open and Save As dialogs (File > Open and File > Save As).

Boolean.Caption: Show hidden files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the Show Hidden Files option on the Open and Save dialogs and the Open tool window is checked by default.

Boolean.Caption: Smooth horizontal scroll
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, editor windows scroll column-by-column when the cursor moves out of view. When set to Off, the cursor is centered and the text is scrolled one-fourth the width of the window when the cursor moves out of view.

Boolean.Caption: Smooth vertical scroll
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, editor windows scroll line-by-line when the cursor moves out of view. When set to Off, the cursor is centered and the text is scrolled half the height of the window when the cursor moves out of view.

Numeric.Caption: Scroll when
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how close (in number of lines) the cursor may get to the top or bottom of the window before scrolling occurs.

Select.Caption: Current line highlight
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the type of highlight to be drawn around the current line.

Color.Caption: Current line box color
Color.DialogHelp: Specifies the color of the box outline when Current line highlight is enabled.

Color.Caption: Current line column color
Color.DialogHelp: Specifies the color for column markers when using a current line highlight with column indicators (Tabs, Syntax Indent, or Decimal rulers). Note that this is the same as the margin color. The column and margin indicators are not displayed when using proportional fonts, as in Unicode files.

Color.Caption: Message visited color
Color.DialogHelp: Specifies the color of the message in Message List after the user has navigated to the associated code location.

Color.Caption: Message modified color
Color.DialogHelp: Specifies the color of the message in Message List after the line at the associated code location is modified.

Dialog.Caption: Colors
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options let you specify colors for screen elements in SlickEdit and create and manage color schemes. Screen colors can inherit their background color from the Window Text color. This is a convenient way to keep all the background colors synchronized.

Dialog.Caption: Symbol Coloring
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options let you specify colors for specific symbol types and create and manage symbol coloring schemes. Select the (None) scheme to disable symbol coloring. The "All symbols - Light background" scheme works best with color schemes with white backgrounds. Likewise, "All symbols - Dark background" is optimized for black backgrounds. To enable or disable Symbol Coloring use the View options for your language or All Languages.

Dialog.Caption: Fonts
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options let you change the fonts used by the command line, status text, and other screen elements. See the Help for font recommendations. Use Window > Font to change the font used in editor windows.
Dialog.Tags: font configuration element command status sbcs dbcs hex file manager diff editor source windows parameter info selection list dialog proportional html size style strikethrough underline only sample before aa bb cc after spacing bold italic fixed unicode fonts use anti aliasing

Dialog.Caption: Toolbars
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use the Toolbars tab to create new toolbars and set options for specific toolbars. Use the Categories tab to add buttons to a toolbar. Use the Options tab to make settings that apply to all toolbars, such as button size and spacing. Note that you can remove a toolbar button when the Toolbars option sheet is displayed by using the mouse to drag the button off of the toolbar.
Dialog.Tags: toolbar customization mouseover customize toolbars current context sessions standard new delete rename reset visible allow docking categories user definable edits selections files buffers searching tagging completion windowing project debug selective bookmarks macros tools version html xml miscellaneous space controls category drag any toolbardisplay then right click properties change command binding options button size small medium large spacing apply show tips delay ms hide application inactive close

Select.Caption: Toolbar button size
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the size of buttons on a toolbar.

Numeric.Caption: Horizontal spacing
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the horizontal spacing between buttons on a toolbar.

Boolean.Caption: Show tool tips
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pop-up tool tips are displayed when the mouse pointer rolls over a button. This option is global to all toolbars.

Numeric.Caption: Tool tip delay (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the delay, in thousands of a second, before tool tips are displayed when Show tool tips is enabled.

Boolean.Caption: Hide when application is inactive
Boolean.DialogHelp: When checked, non-docked toolbars are hidden when you switch to another application. When you switch back to SlickEditÂ®, the toolbar is made visible again. This option is global to all toolbars.

Boolean.Caption: Use unified toolbar
Boolean.DialogHelp: The unified toolbar uses merges the toolbar and title bar into one area, similar to other Mac applications.

Dialog.Caption: Tool Windows
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use the Tool Windows tab to set options for specific tool windows. Use the Options tab to make settings that apply to all tool windows.
Dialog.Tags: tool windows customization mouseover customize backup history bookmarks breakpoints build class clipboards code annotations defs exceptions tabs files replace find ftp client message list notifications open output preview projects references regex evaluator search results slick stack properties symbols unit testing visible always top allow docking esc dismisses floating options close button affects only show auto delay tenths second hide application inactive

Boolean.Caption: Close button affects active tab only
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the Close button on a tool window will close only that tool window. When set to Off and the tool window is tab-linked with other tool windows, the Close button will close all tab-linked tool windows.

Boolean.Caption: Auto hide button affects active tab only
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the Auto Hide button on a tool window will auto-hide only that tool window. When set to Off and the tool window is tab-linked with other tool windows, the Auto Hide button will auto-hide all tab-linked tool windows.

Boolean.Caption: Auto show tool window on mouse over
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, auto-hidden tool windows are auto-displayed when the mouse is over the item in the dock channel.

Numeric.Caption: Delay (tenths of a second)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how long to wait (in tenths of a second) before the mouse triggers an auto-hidden tool window to auto-display.

Condition.Option: Auto show tool window on mouse over

Numeric.Caption: Auto hide delay (tenths of a second)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how long to wait (in tenths of a second) before an auto-displayed tool window auto-hides itself.

Boolean.Caption: Hide when application is inactive
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, tool windows and toolbars are hidden when SlickEdit is not the active application.

Boolean.Caption: Activate Preview tool window from other windows
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, allows you to select which other windows should activate the Preview tool window.

Boolean.Caption: Bookmarks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Bookmarks tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Breakpoints
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Breakpoints tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Class
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Class tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Code Annotations
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Annotations tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Defs
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Defs tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Files tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Find Symbol
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Find Symbol tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Message List
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Message List tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: References
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the References tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Search results
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Search Results tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Symbols
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Symbols tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Boolean.Caption: Unit Test
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selecting an item in the Unit Test tool window will activate the Preview tool window with the corresponding symbol shown.

Condition.Option: Activate Preview tool window from other windows

Dialog.Caption: Special Characters
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Use Hex and Dec to toggle the special characters’ code between hexadecimal and decimal representations. The two End-Of-Line characters are useful when viewing files from Windows/DOS platforms. Use Reset to restore values to the default settings. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.
Dialog.Tags: special characters view hex dec code meaning line tab virtual space end file formfeed reset

Text.Caption: End of line (1)
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: End of line (2)
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: Tab
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: Space
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: Virtual space
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: End of file
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Text.Caption: Formfeed
Text.DialogHelp: These options are used to define the characters that are displayed when view of special characters is enabled. Note that some fonts may not be able to display certain special characters.

Select.Caption: Short key names
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies how keyboard shortcuts are displayed in the MDI menu bar. For example, when Long (CUA) key names is selected, the Undo item on the Edit menu shows Ctrl+Z for the shortcut. When Condensed (non-CUA) key names is selected, C-Z is displayed.

Boolean.Caption: Mac OS style Browse for Folder dialog
Boolean.DialogHelp: (Mac only) When set to On, a Mac OS style Browse for Folder dialog box is used to choose directories when possible. Otherwise, the standard Choose Directory dialog is used at all times.

Boolean.Caption: Mac Retina Display (High DPI) Support
Boolean.DialogHelp: Improves the font rendering on Macs with high resolution Retina displays. May degrade scrolling performance.

Boolean.Caption: Always show full path in titlebar
Boolean.DialogHelp: Show the full Unix-style path in the main window titlebar and do not use the Mac standard proxy icons.

Boolean.Caption: Windows style Browse for Folder dialog
Boolean.DialogHelp: (Windows only) When set to On, a Windows style Browse for Folder dialog box is used to choose directories when possible. Otherwise, the standard Choose Directory dialog is used at all times.

Boolean.Caption: Allow MDI Corner Toolbar
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, allows corner toolbar for MDI documents. Only available for specific Window Managers (Unity).

Category.Caption: Keyboard and Mouse
Category.DialogHelp: These options pertain to use of the keyboard and mouse, including options for setting the emulation you want to use and creating custom key bindings.

Dialog.Caption: Emulation
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use these options to specify the emulation mode and to restore default key bindings. Any custom bindings you have made in an emulation will be saved when you switch emulations.
Dialog.Tags: emulation studio visual slickedit text mode edition brief codewright eclipse vim gnu emacs epsilon ispf codewarrior xcode bbedit cua common user access keyboard uses command set similar used microsoft word notepad restore default bindings

Select.Caption: Emulation
Select.DialogHelp: Use this option to specify the emulation mode of the editor.

Dialog.Caption: Key Bindings
Dialog.DialogHelp: This page lets you view, create, and manage key binding associations for SlickEdit commands and user-recorded macros. You can also import, export, or save a chart of your key bindings.
Dialog.Tags: key bindings - cua keybindings search sequence mode recorded import export save chart run close add click remove unbind current selected command

Select.Caption: Backspace in Replace mode
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the behavior of the Backspace key when the Start mode is set to Replace (Tools > Options > Editing > General). When Remove previous character only is selected, Backspace removes the previous character and moves the cursor left. Otherwise the previous character is replaced with a space.

Select.Caption: Backspace over tab
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the behavior of the Backspace key when the previous character is a tab.

Choice.Caption: Convert tab to spaces and remove 1 space

Select.Caption: Backspace key
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies when the cursor is allowed to wrap to the previous line when pressing the Backspace key at the left margin.

Select.Caption: Delete key
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the behavior of the Delete key when the rest of the current line is empty. When Next line always joins is selected, the line below the current line is joined with the current line.

Choice.Caption: Next line only joins when word wrap is on

Select.Caption: End key
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies where the cursor is placed when pressing the End key.

Choice.Caption: Moves cursor to end of line (Default)
Toggles cursor between end of line and last non-whitespace character

Select.Caption: Enter key
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies whether a line is split when pressing Enter and how the cursor is aligned on the new line.

Choice.Caption: Inserts blank line after current line without splitting current line
Splits current line only when Start in Insert Mode is on

Select.Caption: Home key
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies where the cursor is placed when pressing the Home key.

Choice.Caption: Toggles cursor between first non-blank character and column one (Default)

Boolean.Caption: Use Alt+key for menu drop-downs
Boolean.DialogHelp: (Non-CUA emulation modes only) When set to On, Alt-prefixed keyboard shortcuts display the corresponding drop-down menu. When set to Off, you can be more selective about key bindings because you're permitted to bind Alt+keys you normally could not, such as Alt+F. Set to Off if you bind Alt+keys that are normally menu keys; otherwise, you will lose these key bindings.

Boolean.Caption: Alt menu
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pressing the Alt key without following it with another key causes the focus to shift to the menu bar, and the hotkeys in the menu names are underlined.

Boolean.Caption: Use Command+key for dialog hotkeys
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, the Command key is used for dialog hotkeys.

Boolean.Caption: Use Command+key for menu drop-downs
Boolean.DialogHelp: (Non-CUA emulation modes only) When set to On, Command-prefixed keyboard shortcuts display the corresponding drop-down menu. When set to Off, you can be more selective about key bindings because you're permitted to bind Command+keys you normally could not, such as Command+F. Set to Off if you bind Command+keys that are normally menu keys; otherwise, you will lose these key bindings.

Select.Caption: Mac Option/Alt key behavior
Select.DialogHelp: The default Mac OS X behavior uses Option+Key for entering extended ASCII symbols. Windows-style Alt key allows Option+Letter to be used for user-defined key bindings.

Choice.Caption: Use as Windows-style Alt key modifier

Numeric.Caption: Key message delay (tenths of a second)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum delay, in tenths of a second, between two key combinations when used as a single key binding (for example, Ctrl+X,Ctrl+C). If the time limit is exceeded between when the two key combinations are pressed, the key sequence is interpreted as two separate bindings.

Boolean.Caption: Command line prompting
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pressing a key binding that normally opens a dialog box causes the SlickEdit command line to prompt for arguments instead of opening the dialog. For example, instead of displaying the Open file dialog, Ctrl+O (bound to gui_open) opens the command line prompting for the file to open.

Select.Caption: Selective Display, Expand/collapse
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies how Selective Display expand/collapse bitmaps (View > Selective Display) are clicked in order to expand/collapse areas.

Boolean.Caption: Use Clear key as NumLock
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the Clear key will behave as the NumLock key.

Select.Caption: Initial NumLock state
Select.DialogHelp: Sets the initial value of NumLock when the application is started.

Numeric.Caption: Prefix area width
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of characters to display in the prefix area. To completely remove the prefix area, set this to 0.

Boolean.Caption: Display prefix area for readonly files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the prefix area is displayed for read-only files.

Boolean.Caption: Enter places cursor in prefix area
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pressing Enter places the cursor in the prefix area of the next line. When set to Off, the cursor is placed in column 1 of the next line.

Boolean.Caption: Right CTRL = Enter/Send
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pressing Enter places the cursor at the beginning of the next line, and the right Ctrl key is used to execute line commands. When set to Off, the right Ctrl key behaves like a normal Ctrl key and the Enter key is used to execute line commands.

Boolean.Caption: Cursor page up/down
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, Page Up/Down scrolls the display up/down until the current line becomes the first/last line displayed, respectively. If the cursor is already on the top/bottom display line, the display scrolls one page. When set to False, Page Up/Down always scrolls one page.

Boolean.Caption: END command saves the file
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, changes to the buffer are saved automatically when the ispf_end (F3) command is performed. Otherwise, you are prompted to save changes before closing the file.

Boolean.Caption: XEDIT line commands
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the prefix area supports XEDIT-style line commands.

Boolean.Caption: Home key places cursor on command line
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, pressing the Home key places the cursor on the command line. When set to Off, Home moves the cursor to the beginning of the line.

Boolean.Caption: Enter command mode on ESC during codehelp
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, ESC during any codehelp or autocomplete will not only dismiss the dialog, but will also switch to command mode.

Boolean.Caption: Change cursor shape between modes
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor will change shape when switching between insert and command mode.

Boolean.Caption: Verbose Ex mode prompt
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, display a warning in front of the prompt when staying in Ex mode.

Boolean.Caption: Always highlight search results
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the editor will always highlight all search results.

Boolean.Caption: Start in command mode
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the editor will switch to command mode on any buffer switch.

Category.Caption: Editing
Category.DialogHelp: Editing options directly impact your SlickEdit coding experience. By customizing these options so that SlickEdit works the way you prefer and to which you are accustomed, you can greatly improve your coding speed and efficiency. Editing options include default search/replace values, selection styles, specifying the size of new editor windows, and more.

Select.Caption: Start mode
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the default insert/replace editing mode to use each time the editor is invoked. The editing mode is indicated in the status line of the editor (Ins or Rep). You can also click on the indicator to toggle the editing mode.

Select.Caption: Line insert style
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies whether lines are inserted Before or After the current line when you paste a line selection.

Select.Caption: Next word style
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the cursor behavior when navigating with the next_word command (Ctrl+Right). When Begin is selected, the cursor is placed on the beginning of the next word. When End is selected, the cursor is placed at the end of the next word.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum clipboards
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of clipboards saved. By default, a stack of your last 50 clipboards are kept, any one of which can be pasted with Ctrl+Shift+V.

Boolean.Caption: Allow drag drop of text
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selected text can be copied or moved by dragging and dropping the selection using the left mouse button.

Boolean.Caption: Throw away file lists
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, File Manager file lists (File > File Manager) can be modified and closed without a save prompt.

Boolean.Caption: Auto exit build window
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the concurrent build window is automatically exited when the buffer is closed or when exiting the editor.

Select.Caption: Reflow next
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies where the cursor is placed when running the reflow_paragraph command. When Cursor on next paragraph is selected, the cursor is placed on the next paragraph after it has reformatted the current paragraph.

Boolean.Caption: Protect read-only mode
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, read-only files cannot be modified. If you attempt to modify a read-only file, SlickEdit displays a notification. If you attempt to save a read-only file, SlickEdit prompts for a different output file name.

Boolean.Caption: CUA text box
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the keys Ctrl+X, Ctrl+C, and Ctrl+V perform cut, copy, and paste commands respectively for text boxes other than the command line, regardless of the emulation. When Off, these keys operate the same in a text box as they do in the command line and edit windows, which could be useful if you are using a non-CUA emulation or prefer to use your own editing key bindings.

Boolean.Caption: Preserve column on top/bottom
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the top_of_buffer (Ctrl+Home) and bottom_of_buffer (Ctrl+End) commands do not change the column position unless already at the top or bottom of the buffer.

Boolean.Caption: CR w/o LF erases line in build window
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, lines of output sent to the Build tool window that contain carriage return (CR) characters without subsequent line feed (LF) characters are erased. When set to Off, these lines are not erased.

Select.Caption: Parenthesis matching style
Select.DialogHelp: When typing a closing paren, Highlight selects the text within the paren pair, Cursor to beginning parenthesis temporarily places the cursor on the matching begin paren, and None just inserts the close paren.

Boolean.Caption: Highlight matching blocks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the corresponding parenthesis, brace, bracket, or begin/end word pair under the cursor is automatically highlighted.

Boolean.Caption: Automatically set buffer cache size
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the buffer cache size is automatically set according to the current file size.

Numeric.Caption: Set buffer cache size when file larger than (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: When the current file is larger than this value, SlickEdit will automatically set a more appropriate buffer cache size.

Numeric.Caption: Use Plain Text mode when file larger than (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: When the current file is larger than this value, SlickEdit will open the file in Plain Text mode, turning off most language-related editing features and improving performance.

Numeric.Caption: Turn off undo when editing file larger than (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: When editing a file larger than this value, SlickEdit will turn off Undo capabilities for all files to improve performance.

Select.Caption: Files per window
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies whether each buffer opened in SlickEdit is allocated in its own editor window or in the same editor window.

Boolean.Caption: Hide maximized child window titlebars
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, maximized editor windows will not display a title bar.

Boolean.Caption: Mac resize borders
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, editor windows can be resized from any edge or corner.

Select.Caption: Smart next window style
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies preferences for navigating between editor windows.

Boolean.Caption: Place cursor on focus click
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, clicking in an editor window that does not have focus will set focus and also place the text cursor. When set to Off, clicking in an editor window that does not have focus only sets focus.

Select.Caption: File tab sort order
Select.DialogHelp: Determines in which order the file tabs are sorted. For tabs to be sorted alphabetically by file name, choose Alphabetical. By choosing Most recently opened, the most recently opened file will appear at the very left, while the next most recently opened file will be next, etc. Most recently viewed means that the current file will always be the left-most tab, with the last viewed file next and so on. Choose Manual to drag and drop file tabs where you want them.

Select.Caption: New file tab position
Select.DialogHelp: Determines in where the tabs for newly opened files should appear.

Boolean.Caption: Abbreviate file tab captions
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files with the same name but different extensions will be appreviated so that only the extension will show in the caption for all but the first file. When set to Off, the full file name is shown for every file.

Boolean.Caption: Show close buttons on file tabs
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, individual file tabs will have a close button to allow you to quickly close files.

Select.Caption: New window width
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the width of new editor windows. When Default is selected, the default window size is determined by SlickEdit. When Use current window to create custom size is selected, the current window width is used as the width for new windows. When Use maximum available is selected, new windows will fill the editor pane. Use Custom value to set a custom width. To use the active window to size a new windows, select Use size of active window when new window is created.

Choice.Caption: Use current window to create custom size
Use size of active window when new window is created

Numeric.Caption: Custom window width
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the size, in pixels, for the width of new editor windows.

Select.Caption: New window height
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the height of new editor windows. When Default is selected, the default window size is determined by SlickEdit. When Use current window to create custom size is selected, the current window height is used as the height for new windows. When Use maximum available is selected, new windows will fill the editor pane. Use Custom value to specify a custom height. To use the active window to size new windows, select Use size of active window when new window is created.

Choice.Caption: Use current window to create custom size
Use size of active window when new window is created

Numeric.Caption: Custom window height
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the size, in pixels, for the height of new editor windows.

Boolean.Caption: Cursor right/left wraps to next/previous line
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor_left and cursor_right commands wrap to the previous or next line respectively.

Boolean.Caption: Cursor up/down places cursor in virtual space
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to True, the cursor_up and cursor_down commands place the cursor up or down, respectively, at either the end of the line or at the column of the original location, whichever comes first. The cursor is never placed past the end of the line. When set to Off, cursor_up and cursor_down go to the same column of the next or previous line, regardless of the length of the line.

Boolean.Caption: Click past end of line
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor can be placed past the end of a line into virtual space.

Boolean.Caption: Cursor up/down within soft wrapped lines
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, if Soft Wrap is enabled (View > Soft Wrap), the cursor_down and cursor_up commands move the cursor up to the next or previous visible line, including line continuations. When set to Off, cursor_down and cursor_up moves the cursor to the next or previous physical line (the same position to which the cursor would move if Soft Wrap was off).

Select.Caption: Cursor left/right in leading spaces
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the behavior of the cursor_left and cursor_right commands when moving the cursor within leading space.

Choice.Caption: Move cursor by one physical character

Select.Caption: Line wrap
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies when line wrapping occurs, either when the cursor reaches column one or when it reaches the left margin. When language-specific Word Wrap is on, wrapping occurs when the left margin is reached regardless of this setting.

Choice.Caption: Wrap when column one is reached
Wrap when left margin is reached

Boolean.Caption: Strip leading spaces when joining lines
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, hitting Delete at the end of a line to join with the following line will strip the leading spaces from the following line, effectively joining to the first non-blank character. When set to Off, the leading spaces from the following line will be preserved.

Boolean.Caption: Jump over tab characters
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, moving the cursor over a tab character with the Left or Right arrow key causes the cursor to jump across the virtual space. When set to Off, the Left and Right arrow keys move the cursor into the virtual space of tab characters. Note that this setting also controls where the cursor is placed when clicking in a buffer or making a selection.

Boolean.Caption: Subword Navigation
Boolean.DialogHelp: Word navigation and selection commands handle CamelCase and word separators (dashes, underscores).

Boolean.Caption: Undo affects cursor movement
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, using the undo command will undo each individual cursor movements.

Boolean.Caption: Tag file on save
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files are retagged when you save a modified file.

Boolean.Caption: Background tagging of open files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, all open files are retagged in the background if they have been modified.

Boolean.Caption: Use background thread when possible
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, all open files are retagged in the background using a thread for languages which support threaded tagging.

Numeric.Caption: Start after seconds idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, the editor remains idle (no keyboard or mouse movements) before retagging of buffers starts, if Background tagging of open files is enabled.

Numeric.Caption: Max size of files to tag (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum size, in kilobytes, a file is allowed to have in order to be tagged.

Numeric.Caption: Max number of tags per file
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of tags (including statements, if Statement Level Tagging is enabled) that a file is allowed to have in order to appear in the Defs and Current Context tool windows.

Boolean.Caption: Update workspace tag file on open
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, background tagging will update the workspace tag file on a thread when the workspace is opened.

Boolean.Caption: Update workspace tag file on activate
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, background tagging will update the workspace tag file on a thread when SlickEdit loses focus or gains focus.

Boolean.Caption: Background tagging of other files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, tag files are updated when another application modifies a file. Note that this causes SlickEdit to frequently perform disk I/O to check dates of files on disk.

Boolean.Caption: Workspace tag file only
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, background tagging cycles through only the workspace tag file. When set to Off, background tagging cycles through all of your extension-specific tag files (listed under Tools > Tag Files) in addition to the workspace tag file.

Numeric.Caption: Start after minutes idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, the editor remains idle (no keyboard or mouse movements) before retagging of files on disk starts, if Background tagging of open files is enabled.

Numeric.Caption: Minutes before restarting
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of minutes to wait for background tagging to start again after all files have been fully tagged.

Numeric.Caption: Number of tagging threads to start
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of threads to create for processing background tagging jobs. There is no performance benefit to setting this higher than the number of processors on your machine. Setting this to 0 will disable all tagging thread support for all languages. You have to restart the editor for a change to this setting to take effect.

Boolean.Caption: Create dedicated tagging thread for reading files from disk
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, an additional background tagging thread is created which is dedicated to reading files from disk. This improves performance by reducing disk contention between tagging threads and by pipelining reading and parsing operations. You have to restart the editor for a change to this setting to take effect.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Boolean.Caption: Create dedicated tagging thread for writing to the tag database
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, an additional background tagging thread is created which is dedicated to writing tagging information to the tag database. This improves performance by reducing disk contention between tagging threads and by pipelining parsing operations and tag database updates. You have to restart the editor for a change to this setting to take effect.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Boolean.Caption: Use background thread to build workspace tag file when possible
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the workspace tag file is initially built and updated using a background thread instead of being built immediately (synchronously). This option only applies to languages which support threaded tagging.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Boolean.Caption: Use background thread to build language support tag files when possible
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, language support tag files are initially built and updated using a background thread instead of being built immediately (synchronously). This option only applies to languages which support threaded tagging.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Boolean.Caption: Report background tagging progress on status bar
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, display messages on the status bar as files are tagged in the background in order to show that background tagging is making progress.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Numeric.Caption: Process background tagging jobs after (ms) idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of idle time to wait before starting to poll for completed background tagging jobs to complete processing.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Numeric.Caption: Background tagging timeout (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum amount of time to spend gathering background tagging results before returning control to the editor.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Numeric.Caption: Maximum number of active tagging jobs
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of background tagging jobs to allow to be active in the background tagging processing queues at once. This setting is used to limit the amount of memory that background tagging can consume while running. You have to restart the editor for a change to this setting to take effect.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start

Boolean.Caption: Minimize write locking when updating database (uses more memory)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, specifies that background tagging should minimize the amount of time the database is locked for writing. It does this by caching modified blocks in memory until background tagging is done updating all the records for a file. There is no set limit on how much more memory this option uses, but in general, it will require an additional 10-50M while background tagging is running. You have to restart the editor for a change to this setting to take effect.

NotCondition.Option: Number of tagging threads to start
Create dedicated tagging thread for writing to the tag database

Numeric.Caption: Update tool windows after (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, the editor waits before updating the Defs, Preview, and Current Context tool windows.

Numeric.Caption: Additional time to wait before updating tool windows (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies an additional amount of time, in milliseconds, the editor waits before updating tool windows, Auto Complete, and Symbol Coloring. This gives background threads more time to update the current file before these tool windows are updated.

Numeric.Caption: Preview window symbol lookup timeout (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: The preview window will spend up to this amount of time when it looks up a symbol. If it does not find it in that time, it will not display the symbol preview. Smaller values will help prevent typing delays.

Boolean.Caption: Show preview of symbols in tagging tool windows on mouse-over
Boolean.DialogHelp: Indicates whether or not to show symbols in the preview window when the mouse is hovered over them in tagging-related tool windows or the file tabs.

Numeric.Caption: Show preview of symbols in tagging tool windows after (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Indicates the amount of time, in milliseconds, to delay before showing symbols in the preview window when the mouse is hovered over them in tagging-related tool windows or the file tabs.

NotCondition.Option: Show preview of symbols in tagging tool windows on mouse-over

Boolean.Caption: Build workspace tag file with references
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, newly created tag files are built with support for symbol cross-references.

Boolean.Caption: Find references incrementally (faster)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, reference queries are faster because analysis stops when a file is found containing a valid reference. When set to Off, all files with potential references are searched and analyzed so that the files which do not contain any references are removed.

Boolean.Caption: Update references and call tree on single click
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, references in the References tool window are updated when you click on a new symbol in the Classes, Defs, or Symbols tool window.

Boolean.Caption: "Go to reference" only lists references
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, Go to Reference searches for references but does not jump immediately to the first reference. When set to Off, Go to Reference searches for references and automatically jumps to the first one.

Boolean.Caption: Search for word matches if symbol is not found
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, Go to Reference will search for simple word matches if the symbol under the cursor is not found by Context Tagging®.

Boolean.Caption: Highlight references in editor
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, each reference is highlighted within files.

Boolean.Caption: Allow mixed language references
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, allow the system to also search for references in files that do not match the source language for the symbol in question.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum functions found by parameter help
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of overloaded functions to display when function parameter help (Parameter Information) is invoked.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum class/struct members shown
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of class/struct members to display in the Class Tool Window.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum response time for list members (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that SlickEdit spends finding symbols to display using list members or completing symbols.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum candidates for list parameters
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of local variables and class members that are evaluated to determine assignment compatibility when Auto List Compatible Parameters is invoked.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum response time for list parameters (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that SlickEdit spends finding compatible parameters. Note that this is not a hard limit; in some cases, evaluating the assignment compatibility of a single variable can be time-consuming, especially when templates are involved.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum tags found in symbol search
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of tags found when Find Tag is invoked (right-click in the Symbols tool window and select Find Tag). This setting also controls the number of duplicate tags that are tried when SlickEdit is attempting to evaluate the type of a symbol.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum items found in references search
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies that a symbol references search should stop after this many hits are found.

Numeric.Caption: Tag file cache size (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the cache size, in kilobytes, for tag files. Tagging performance can be improved by adjusting this setting to better match the size of your tag files. Generally, a tag file cache size that matches the total size of the tag files being used will provide the best performance. Note: This is the same as the Tag File Cache Size option under Tools > Options > Application Options > Virtual Memory.

Numeric.Caption: Tag file cache maximum (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum cache size, in kilobytes, for tag files. The tag file cache size can be dynamically adjusted as high as this amount depending on the amount of available memory on your machine at the time SlickEdit is started.

Numeric.Caption: Update after (ms) idle (0 implies no delay)
Numeric.DialogHelp: This option controls the idle time in milliseconds before the List Members feature displays the list.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum response time (ms) for highlighting matching symbols
Numeric.DialogHelp: Highlighting matching symbols should time out after this period of time and not match any more symbols. If you set this very low, you can protect against typing delays, however, you will only see a partial list of matching symbols highlighted in the current file.

Numeric.Caption: Update after (ms) idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: After a modification has been made to a file, wait this amount of time before updating the symbol coloring information for that file. Based on average typing speed, we do not recommend setting this less than 250 ms.

Numeric.Caption: Timeout after (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Symbol coloring will be done in time slices no greater than the amount specified. If you set this very low, you can protect against typing delays, however, you may see the symbols coloring from top to bottom instead of seeing the whole page colored in one shot.

Numeric.Caption: Number of lines to color above and below the current page
Numeric.DialogHelp: For best performance, symbol coloring only colors the current visible page of lines, and a small window of surrounding lines. This setting allows you to configure how many lines before and after the current visible page of lines are also colored. Set this to 0 for optimal performance with no prefetch of symbol coloring information.

Numeric.Caption: Number of off-page lines to color per pass (chunk size)
Numeric.DialogHelp: After calculating the symbol coloring for the lines on the current page, symbol coloring will start prefetching coloring for surrounding lines (see above). This setting controls the number of lines calculated per pass.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum symbols
Numeric.DialogHelp: For performance tuning, you can limit the maximum number of symbols displayed by Auto-Complete.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum function prototypes
Numeric.DialogHelp: For performance tuning, you can limit the maximum number of symbols displayed with their function arguments

Numeric.Caption: Maximum word completions
Numeric.DialogHelp: For performance tuning, you can limit the maximum number of word completions displayed by Word Completion.

Numeric.Caption: Display after (ms) idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: This option specifies the number of milliseconds the editor must be idle before auto-completion suggestions will be displayed.

Numeric.Caption: Update after (ms) idle
Numeric.DialogHelp: This option specifies the number of milliseconds the editor must be idle before auto-completion suggestions will be refreshed.

Numeric.Caption: Timeout after (ms) when automatic
Numeric.DialogHelp: For performance tuning, you can limit the amount of time that Auto-Complete spends finding suggestions when it comes up automatically. Set this to less than a second to avoid typing delays.

Numeric.Caption: Timeout after (ms) on demand
Numeric.DialogHelp: For performance tuning, you can limit the amount of time that Auto-Complete spends finding suggestions when it is invoked manually. Set this to as much as a minute, depending on how long you might be willing to wait for results.

Dialog.Caption: Workspace Tagging Excludes
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use this dialog to specify absolute paths and partial path components that you wish to exclude from tagging operations. Use 'Add Full Path...' to browse to a specific directory on the filesystem. Use 'Add Path Component...' to enter a generic directory name under which all files will be excluded from tagging. For example, specifying 'Build\obj' will cause tagging to ignore all files with 'Build\obj' in their absolute path.

Dialog.Caption: Selections
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options affect the behavior of SlickEdit regarding selections. When Shift+Cursor always char select is off, Shift+ performs a line or block selection depending on the direction you move the cursor. When Mouse selection creates clipboard is on, use the mouse to create a selection and press the middle mouse button to paste. When Arrow keys traverse selection is on, the left/right arrow key moves the cursor to the beginning/end of the selection, respectively.
Dialog.Tags: selections styles user defined cua slickedit default extend copy after paste inclusive character delete before insert auto deselect ie moves shiftcursor always mouse creates arrow keys traverse enable block right click drag indent text selected clipboard formats html

Boolean.Caption: Shift + Cursor always does character selection
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to Off, pressing Shift+<arrow keys> will select line or block selections, depending on the direction the cursor moves.

Boolean.Caption: Mouse selections creates clipboard
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the left mouse button is used to create a clipboard selection, and the middle mouse button is used to paste.

Boolean.Caption: Arrow keys traverse selection
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the left arrow key moves the cursor to the beginning of the selection and the right arrow moves to the end of the selection.

Boolean.Caption: Enable block selections with right-click and drag
Boolean.DialogHelp: When On, a selection can be made with the right mouse button instead of displaying the language-specific menu. When this is Off, select menu items by clicking and dragging the mouse.

Boolean.Caption: Indent selection when text selected
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is On, pressing Tab or Shift+Tab indents or unindents the selected text.

Boolean.Caption: Extend selection as cursor moves
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a selection is extended to the cursor position as the cursor moves.

Boolean.Caption: Deselect after copy
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selected text is immediately deselected after a copy operation. When set to Off, the text remains selected.

Boolean.Caption: Deselect after paste
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selected text is immediately deselected after a paste operation. When set to Off, the text remains selected.

Boolean.Caption: Inclusive character selection
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a character selection includes the character following the cursor.

Select.Caption: Deselect
Select.DialogHelp: This option controls deselection behavior.

Boolean.Caption: HTML format
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, selections copied to the clipboard will be in HTML format so that formatting and color coding can be maintained.

Boolean.Caption: Match case
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, search commands default to case-sensitive searches.

Boolean.Caption: Match whole word
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, search commands default to only finding matches to the word as a whole.

Boolean.Caption: Regular expression
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, search commands default to regular expression searching.

Select.Caption: Regular expression syntax
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies which regular expression syntax to use for default regex searching, when Regular Expression search is enabled.

Select.Caption: Wrap at beginning/end
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies whether or not search commands always wrap at the beginning or end of a buffer during a search/replace operation to complete a search.

Boolean.Caption: Search backward
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, searches are always performed from the end to the beginning.

Boolean.Caption: Place cursor at end
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor is placed at the end of the found occurrence.

Boolean.Caption: Search hidden text
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, text hidden by Selective Display is allowed to be searched.

Boolean.Caption: Close after find/replace
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the Find and Replace tool window is closed after finding text in the buffer.

Boolean.Caption: Initialize with default options
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, options on the Find and Replace tool window are reset to the original default values each time the window is launched.

Select.Caption: Initialize search string
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the initial value to be used in the Search For fields of the Find and Replace tool window when the window is activated.

Boolean.Caption: Selected text (if exists)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the current selection is used as the initial value in the Search For fields of the Find and Replace tool window when the window is activated. If a selection does not exist, the value specified by the Initialize search string option is used.

Boolean.Caption: Restore cursor after replace
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor is restored to its original position after a search/replace operation completes without being cancelled.

Boolean.Caption: Leave selected
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the last occurrence of a matching search string is left selected when a search operation completes.

Boolean.Caption: Incremental search highlighting
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, incremental searching highlights matching occurrences with two colors: one for the current match at the cursor and one for all possible matches. Highlights are removed when the search terminates. These colors are controlled by the I-Search Current Match and I-Search Highlight screen elements (Tools > Options > Appearance > Colors).

Numeric.Caption: Maximum search results output (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies size for Search Results buffer. When buffer exceeds maximum size, the Search Results output switches to listing matching files only.

Boolean.Caption: Use workspace bookmarks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, bookmarks are associated with the workspace used to create them, even if the files they are in are not part of the workspace. When you switch workspaces, the Bookmarks tool window updates to show only the bookmarks associated with the current workspace.

Boolean.Caption: Show set bookmarks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a green Bookmark bitmap is displayed in the left margin of the editor window at the location of each set bookmark.

Boolean.Caption: Show pushed bookmarks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a blue Bookmark bitmap is displayed in the left margin of the editor window at the location of each pushed bookmark.

Boolean.Caption: Close deletes pushed bookmarks
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, any pushed bookmarks remaining are removed when a buffer is closed.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum stack depth
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of bookmarks kept in the bookmark stack. When this number is exceeded, the oldest bookmark is removed from the stack.

Select.Caption: Automatically close visited files
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the closing of visited files. A file is considered as visited if it is opened as a result of a symbol navigation or search operation, and not modified, and subsequently navigated away from, for example, by using pop_bookmark (Ctrl+Comma).

Boolean.Caption: Top/bottom buffer pushes bookmark
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit pushes a bookmark before jumping to the top or bottom of the current buffer. This allows you to use pop_bookmark to jump back to the previous location.

Boolean.Caption: Navigating search results pushes bookmark
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit pushes a bookmark when you navigate between search results. This allows you to use pop_bookmark to jump back to the previous location.

Select.Caption: Show navigation hints
Select.DialogHelp: Select how to display navigation hint location in editor window.

Boolean.Caption: Enter
Boolean.DialogHelp: Jump to end of automatically inserted punctuation on Enter key.

Boolean.Caption: Tab
Boolean.DialogHelp: Jump to end of automatically inserted punctuation on Tab key.

Dialog.Caption: Global Aliases
Dialog.DialogHelp: Aliases are identifiers you can quickly type, which are expanded into snippets of text. Global aliases are more commonly used for directories because they can be used in all text boxes including the open dialog. To create a new alias, click New and enter an identifier. Type the substitution text in the alias editor box. Type the identifier and press Ctrl+Space to expand the alias in a text box or Ctrl+Shift+O (default) in an edit window.

Category.Caption: Debugging
Category.DialogHelp: Debugger options are used for tuning the run-time performance of the integrated debugger, examining the properties of the underlying debugger system, setting class filters, and controlling the directories searched for source files.

Numeric.Caption: Number of lines to scan for Autos
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of lines, starting with the current line, to scan for symbols to evaluate and display in the Autos tab of the Debug Variables tool window.

Numeric.Caption: Response timeout (seconds)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of seconds to wait for a connection or response from the underlying debugger system before giving up.

Numeric.Caption: Minimum running update time (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the minimum amount of time in milliseconds to spend polling for asynchronous events coming from the underlying debugger system. This value is also used to determine the frequency with which to poll for events when the application is running.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum suspended update time (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum amount of time in milliseconds to spend polling for asynchronous events coming from the underlying debugger system. This value is also used to determine the frequency with which to poll for events when the application is suspended. Decreasing the minimum and maximum update times will make the editor more responsive in some cases during debugging, however, increasing these times can improve overall performance.

Numeric.Caption: Toolbar update delay (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time to wait in milliseconds before updating the debugger toolbars. This is done to improve debugger performance and decrease overhead and redraws when single stepping through code. Set this value to 0 to force an immediate update.

Numeric.Caption: Asynchronous message duration (seconds)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time in seconds to display certain informative messages caused by asynchronous events (such as loading classes in Java) before they are erased.

Text.Caption: vsdebugio connection port
Text.DialogHelp: Specifies the TCP/IP port to connect to vsdebugio running locally on the same machine.

Boolean.Caption: Allow edit and continue (hot swap) where available
Boolean.DialogHelp: (Java only) When set to On, you can edit a file during a Java debugging session, compile or rebuild, and then continue to debug. Keep in mind that when using this feature, there are certain feature limitations that you might encounter that are defined by the Java Virtual Machine.

Boolean.Caption: Allow editing of source files during debugging
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, you can edit files during debugging sessions.

Boolean.Caption: Show value of symbol under mouse
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, as the mouse cursor floats over a symbol, the information about the symbol, including its value for variables, are displayed.

Boolean.Caption: Automatically correct breakpoint scope
Boolean.DialogHelp: When a breakpoint is set in the debugger, the name of the function and the class it is in is recorded. If the class name or function name subsequently changes between debugging sessions, having this option enabled will allow the debugger to correct this information stored with the breakpoint.

Select.Caption: Short
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Integer
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Long
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Unsigned
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Float
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Double
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Select.Caption: Character
Select.DialogHelp: These options can be used to configure settings for viewing numbers in multiple bases (hex, octal, and binary views).

Dialog.Caption: Runtime Filters
Dialog.DialogHelp: Affects behavior of Step Into (Debug > Step Into, command debug_step_into). Step Into will step over statements that call into run-time functions or classes. For GNU C/C++, click Add to specify a function, or class and method patterns (ex. strcpy, str*, MyClass::*, MyClass::Insert*) for the debugger to consider as run-time functions. For Java, click Add to specify packages or specific classes or class patterns for the debugger to consider as run-time classes.
Dialog.Tags: debugger runtime filters add delete reset

Dialog.Caption: Directories
Dialog.DialogHelp: Click Add to add the search path used to find source files while debugging.
Dialog.Tags: debugger directories add delete reset confirm source file directory

Dialog.Caption: Configurations
Dialog.DialogHelp: Valid only for projects utilizing the GDB debugger, these settings provide the ability to define multiple GDB debuggers, specify arguments to be passed to each debugger in the list, and define one of the debuggers in the list as the default to be used when debugging local, native executables.
Dialog.Tags: debugger configurations target name path arguments default native debugging

Category.Caption: Languages
Category.DialogHelp: Many features in SlickEdit can be configured on a language-specific basis, for example, indenting and word wrap styles. Use Language options to control the behavior of SlickEdit when you need to work with multiple languages.

Dialog.Caption: Language Manager
Dialog.DialogHelp: This page shows a list of languages recognized by SlickEdit. Languages that are installed by default are denoted with a green SlickEdit bitmap. Click Add to add a new language or Delete to remove a language you have added (installed languages cannot be removed).
Dialog.Tags: language manager languages delete add settings

Dialog.Caption: File Extension Manager
Dialog.DialogHelp: This page is used to add and work with file extensions in SlickEdit. Recognized file extensions are shown in the list. Click New to add an extension or Delete to remove an extension. Click Language Setup to go to the General language-specific options page. Open Application and Use file association are used to specify the application in which to open files from the Projects tool window. To associate files without extensions to a language, use the Extensionless File Manager.
Dialog.Tags: manage extensions new delete associate language setup encoding use association open files using different application

Dialog.Caption: Extensionless File Manager
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use this dialog to map files without extensions to language modes such that the file will be treated as a file of that type. Associate a specific file with a language by adding that file to the Files tree. Map any extensionless file with a specific name or within a particular directory by adding it to the Patterns tree. To map all files with a specific extension to a language, see the File Extension Manager.
Dialog.Tags: advanced file types manager language edit filename path add delete up move down files patterns

Dialog.Caption: Formatting
Dialog.DialogHelp: These language-specific options let you configure the way SlickEdit formats code as you type. Depending on the language, you can specify the code formatting templates, how various syntactical elements are treated, when and what code elements are automatically inserted, and more.
Dialog.Tags: formatting *ALL_LANGUAGES* syntax tabs adaptive keyword none begin end if style immediately blank braces quick unbrace statements place else same line tags attributes inserted single capitalize hex values uppercase lowercase options default scheme content wrapping enable layout use continuation function parameters indent switch space before parenthesis padding between parentheses auto symbol translation

Dialog.Caption: Formatting
Dialog.DialogHelp: These language-specific options let you configure the way SlickEdit formats code as you type. Depending on the language, you can specify the code formatting templates, how various syntactical elements are treated, when and what code elements are automatically inserted, and more.
Dialog.Tags: cobol formatting options tabs lowercase uppercase capitalize none adaptive keywords syntax numbering spf style columns embedded dialect pl sql server db indent amount first level code multi line if expansion begin end pairs auto insert label

Dialog.Caption: Formatting
Dialog.DialogHelp: These language-specific options let you configure the way SlickEdit formats code as you type. Depending on the language, you can specify the code formatting templates, how various syntatical elements are treated, when and what code elements are automatically inserted, and more.

Dialog.Caption: Formatting

Dialog.Caption: Compiler Properties
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use these settings to configure your compilers so that SlickEdit can correctly perform full preprocessing, parsing, symbol analysis, and cross-referencing. The Compiler Name list contains a list of compilers. To add a new compiler, click Add to specify a name, then use the Configuration section to specify the header file and include directories (in C/C++) or JDK root installation directory and system libraries (in Java).
Dialog.Tags: c/c++ compiler properties directory name add delete copy set default build tag configuration header file optional built include directories

Dialog.Caption: Organize Imports
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options control the behavior of the Organize Imports and Auto Import features for Java. To organize Java imports, from the main menu, click Tools > Imports > Organize Imports.
Dialog.Tags: organize imports (refactoring) blank line between groups java automatically add during code jsp sort order explicit limit before using wildcard number package nesting levels

Numeric.Caption: Package explicit limit before using wildcard (.*)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of classes that can be imported from the same package in one file before those imports are replaced with a single wildcard import.

Boolean.Caption: Add blank line between groups of imports
Boolean.DialogHelp: Organize Imports will group imports by package name or top-level package name. When this option is set to On, a blank line will be added between these groups. When set to Off, a flag list of imports will be inserted.

Numeric.Caption: Number of package nesting levels to group imports by
Numeric.DialogHelp: When set to 1, import statements will be grouped by top-level package name only. When set to 2, import statements will be grouped by second-level package names.

Condition.Option: Add blank line between groups of imports

Boolean.Caption: Automatically add import during code help for Java
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit will automatically attempt to add imports as you edit Java code.

Boolean.Caption: Automatically add import during code help for JSP
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit will automatically attempt to add imports as you edit Java code embedded in HTML.

Text.Caption: Package sort order
Text.DialogHelp: This list specifies the order in which package groups are sorted.

Category.Caption: File Options
Category.DialogHelp: Use File Options to specify how files are loaded into the editor, saved, backed up, and more.

Boolean.Caption: Edit "A B C" start on file A
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the first file opened becomes the active buffer.

Select.Caption: Open files using
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies which style of open dialog you wish to use to open files. To use the Open Tool Window, specify Smart Open. To use the traditional open dialog, specify Browse files with Open dialog.

Select.Caption: e/edit command Smart Open
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the completion behavior when using the edit command.

Choice.Caption: Smart Open workspace files and open documents

Boolean.Caption: Set current directory when switching buffers
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, sets the current directory to the location of the selected file each time you change buffers.

Boolean.Caption: Dismiss on select
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set the On, the Open Tool Window is closed or auto-hidden after a file is selected and opened. When set to Off, the tool window remains open and visible.

Boolean.Caption: Clear text box on Enter
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set the On, the File name text box will be cleared when Enter is pressed. When set to Off, characters in the text box will remain.

Boolean.Caption: Sync current directory
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, then changes made to the current directory outside of the Open Tool Window are reflected in the tool window. Changing the current directory in the Open Tool Window also changes the current directory of the entire application. When set to Off, the Open Tool Window maintains its own current directory.

Boolean.Caption: Prefix match
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the file name filter of the Open Tool Window is treated as a prefix match, and only file names beginning with the specified text will be shown. When set to Off, all file names containing the filter text will be shown.

Boolean.Caption: Show folders in file list
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files and folders are shown in the top pane of the Open tool window. This allows patterns in the File name field to match folders as well as files.

Boolean.Caption: Show/match workspace and project files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files from the current project and workspace are shown when their file names match the file name filter text or when they are in the current directory. When set to Off, these files are never shown in the Open Tool Window.

Boolean.Caption: Show/match open files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, currently open files are shown when their file names match the file name filter text or when they are in the current directory. When set to Off, these files are never shown in the Open Tool Window.

Boolean.Caption: Show/match files in history
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files in the file history are shown when their file names match the file name filter text or when they are in the current directory. When set to Off, these files are never shown in the Open Tool Window.

Numeric.Caption: Maximum number of files to list
Numeric.DialogHelp: To improve performance, only a limited number of files are shown in the upper panel of the Open Tool Window. When filtering the file list based on a search string, this limit is not used. The limit also applies to the Workspace tab of the Files Tool Window.

Boolean.Caption: Fast line count on partial load
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit counts the number of lines when files are opened.

Boolean.Caption: Show EOF character
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the EOF character is not removed when a file is loaded.

Boolean.Caption: Expand tabs to spaces
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the entire contents of files are read into memory and tabs are expanded into spaces.

Boolean.Caption: File locking
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, a file handle is kept open to the file for locking purposes. This detects when another user is editing the same file.

Boolean.Caption: Reinsert after current
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit switches back to the previous buffer with the prev_buffer command.

Numeric.Caption: Wrap line length
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of characters at which long lines should be wrapped when a file is opened. This option improves editing performance and is particularly useful for editing very large, single-line XML files.

Boolean.Caption: Use undo
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, modifications to buffers may be undone (Ctrl+Z or Edit > Undo).

Numeric.Caption: Max undo steps
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of steps that are stored for undo operations when Use Undo is enabled. Cursor motion can be undone but is not counted as a step.

Boolean.Caption: Save/restore file position
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the cursor position in files is preserved on close and restored on open.

Numeric.Caption: Max files
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum number of recently closed cursor positions to save when Save/Restore File Position is enabled.

Select.Caption: Encoding
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the global (non-extension specific) file encoding. This setting is overridden if a extension-specific encoding is defined on the File Extension Manager for the selected language (Tools > Options > Languages > File Extension Manager). Both the extension-specific and global setting are overridden if you specify an encoding in the Open dialog.

Boolean.Caption: Open extensionless files with SlickEdit
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, extensionless files opened in Eclipse will always use the SlickEdit editor.

Boolean.Caption: Load entire file
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the entire contents of opened files are read into memory. When Off, Auto Reload does not work until the file is saved.

Boolean.Caption: Load partially for large files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the editor only partially loads files larger than the size specified in Load Partially When Files Are Larger, in order to conserve memory.

Numeric.Caption: Load partially when files are larger than (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the size limit for files to be opened completely in the editor. If the size of the file being loaded is greater than this value, only a portion of the file is read into memory.

Boolean.Caption: Count number of lines
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the entire contents of opened files are read into memory and the number of lines in the file are counted.

Boolean.Caption: Truncate file at EOF
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the entire contents of the opened files are read into memory and the number of lines are counted. In addition, DOS format files are truncated when an EOF (End of File) character is found.

Boolean.Caption: Auto reload
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit detects when files being edited have been modified by other applications and prompts to replace the file with the new copy on disk.

Boolean.Caption: Suppress prompt unless modified
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files that have been changed on disk are automatically reloaded unless the file has been modified in SlickEdit.

Boolean.Caption: Compare file contents before auto reload
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, if auto reload detects that the current file has been changed on disk, SlickEdit will also compare the contents of the file on disk with the version in memory to determine if it really needs to be reloaded. This option is useful when you have a file system which does not report modification dates correctly.

Numeric.Caption: Size limit for comparing contents (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the size limit below which files are compared to verify that they need to be reloaded.

Condition.Option: Compare file contents before auto reload

Boolean.Caption: Auto read only
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit detects when other applications change the read-only attribute of a file, and automatically changes the permissions of the file being edited to match.

Boolean.Caption: Fast auto read only
