Boolean.DialogHelp: (Windows only) When set to On, this option speeds up the Auto Read Only feature by only checking the attribute on disk (not opening every file).

Boolean.Caption: Reload on switch buffer
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit detects if a file has been modified by another application when you switch buffers to view the file in the active editor window. When Off, the default check is still performed when you switch from another application.

Boolean.Caption: Auto reload current file only
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit will check if the current open file has been modified by another application when you switch buffers switch from another application. Otherwise, all files are checked for reload. Enabling this option can improve performance when switching from another application back to SlickEdit.

Boolean.Caption: Auto reload all files if current file changed
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, if auto reload detects that the current file has been channged on disk or deleted, SlickEdit will then check if any other open files have been changed on disk or deleted.

Numeric.Caption: Auto reload timeout (ms)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time to wait for file information before skipping auto reload.

Boolean.Caption: Show auto reload timeout notifications
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the user will be given a message when auto reload is skipped for a file

Boolean.Caption: Append EOF character
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, an EOF (End of File) character is appended to the end of DOS files when the buffer is saved. Has no effect on UNIX, Mac, or binary files.

Boolean.Caption: Remove EOF character
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the EOF (End of File) character is removed from the end of DOS files when the buffer is saved. Has no effect on UNIX, Mac, or binary files.

Boolean.Caption: Expand tabs to spaces
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, tabs are expanded to spaces according to the tab stops when the buffer is saved.

Select.Caption: Strip trailing spaces
Select.DialogHelp: When set to Strip all trailing spaces, trailing spaces at the end lines are stripped when the buffer is saved. You can also set this option to only strip trailing spaces from lines that have been inserted or modified.

Choice.Caption: Strip trailing spaces only from modified lines

Boolean.Caption: Save files on loss of focus
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, all modified files are saved when you switch to another application.

Boolean.Caption: Reset modified lines
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, line modify flags are reset when the buffer is saved.

Boolean.Caption: Add file to project upon Save As
Boolean.DialogHelp: This option controls the default value of the Add to Project option on the Save As dialog.

Select.Caption: Make backup files
Select.DialogHelp: Select Create backup history on save to use Backup History. This creates a version of the file each time you save, allowing you to compare and restore to earlier versions. Select Create backup file on first save to create a single backup file that preserves the file contents prior to editing.

Choice.Caption: Create backup file on first save

Select.Caption: Backup location
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies where the backup files will be created. This option is not available when using Create backup history on save. If you select Global directory or Global nested directories you will need to provide a value for Backup directory path.

Condition.Value: Create backup file on first save

DirectoryPath.Caption: Backup directory path
DirectoryPath.DialogHelp: Used to specify the full path to the location used for creating backup files. This is used only when the value for Backup location is Global directory or Global nested directories or when the value for Make backup files is Create backup history on save. Press Delete to clear this field, specifying the default.

Condition.Value: Create backup file on first save

Numeric.Caption: Number of backups to keep for each file
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the number of backups to store for each file.

Boolean.Caption: Limit size of backup
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit limits backups to the size specified in the option Maximum Size to Backup.

Condition.Value: Create backup file on first save

Numeric.Caption: Maximum size to backup (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum size, in kilobytes, for files in order to be backed up when Limit Size of Backup is enabled.

Condition.Value: Create backup file on first save

Boolean.Caption: Use timeout
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit stops comparing after the time out and stores a backup of the entire file.

Numeric.Caption: Timeout (Seconds)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum time to wait for compare, in seconds, before storing entire version of file.

Text.Caption: Exclusions
Text.DialogHelp: Specifies a list of directories which that files under should not be backed up using backup history.

Boolean.Caption: AutoSave activated
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, AutoSave is enabled. AutoSave creates temporary files in the autosave directory of the user config. These files are deleted the next time AutoSave occurs (on save or file close) and when the editor is closed. AutoSave does not save buffers that have are not named.

Numeric.Caption: Save after period of inactivity (seconds)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of idle time, in seconds, after which modified files are saved. Set this value to 0 if you want this option ignored.

Boolean.Caption: Exit SlickEdit on AutoSave
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the SlickEdit application closes after an AutoSave, if AutoSave is enabled.

Numeric.Caption: Save after period of time (seconds)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the amount of time, in seconds, after which modified files should be saved. Set this value to 0 if you want this option ignored.

Select.Caption: Save to
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies save options for AutoSave temporary files. When Save to different directory is selected, AutoSave files are placed in the directory specified in the AutoSave Directory field.

DirectoryPath.Caption: AutoSave directory
DirectoryPath.DialogHelp: Specifies a different directory to use for AutoSave temporary files when Save to different directory is selected in the Save to options. If this field is blank, <configuration_directory>\autosave is used. To find the location of your configuration directory, see Help > About. Press Delete to clear this field, specifying the default.

Numeric.Caption: Largest file to AutoSave (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum size, in kilobytes, a file is allowed to have in order to be automatically saved. To have all files auto-saved, set this value to 0.

Dialog.Caption: Files of Type Filters
Dialog.DialogHelp: The order of the filters specifies the order they will appear in the Open and Save As dialogs. The first file filter is used to initialize the file list. Use the Up and Down arrow buttons to change the order. To add a new filter, click the Add button and enter the new filter name. Then set the value using the Filter value box on the options screen. Separate each filter with a comma. Place file patterns in parentheses and separate them with a semicolon.
Dialog.Tags: filter editor name value

Dialog.Caption: Associate File Types
Dialog.DialogHelp: Files of associated types load in SlickEdit when you open them from within Windows Explorer.
Dialog.Tags: associate file types extensions unassociated disassociate customize

Dialog.Caption: History
Dialog.DialogHelp: This page shows a history of items recently opened from the File or Project menu. When you select a menu, the Items box updates to show the latest files that were opened from that menu. Click Delete to remove selected items from the history list.
Dialog.Tags: history menu items delete size language modes file number recent types store on project new close

Numeric.Caption: Number of files to show in File menu history
Numeric.DialogHelp: Controls how many recently opened files to show in the File menu.

Numeric.Caption: Number of workspaces to show in Project menu history
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how many recently opened workspaces to show in the Project menu.

Numeric.Caption: Number of recent language modes to store on File > New
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how many recently used language modes to store on the New File dialog found at File > New.

Numeric.Caption: Number of recent project types to store on Project > New
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how many recently used project types to store on the New Project dialog found at Project > New.

Category.Caption: Application Options
Category.DialogHelp: These options pertain to the SlickEdit application. You can specify what parts of SlickEdit should be restored on startup, the amount of virtual memory to use, and more.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files and editor windows that were open in your last edit session are restored when you start SlickEdit.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore clipboards
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, clipboards are preserved and restored across editing sessions.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore working directory
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the working directory is preserved and restored across editing sessions.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore build window
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the concurrent process buffer is preserved and restored across editing sessions.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore workspace
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the open workspace is preserved and restored across editing sessions. When set to Off, SlickEdit opens with no workspace open.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore workspace files
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, files and windows that were open in the workspace previously are restored when you switch between workspaces.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore line modify
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, line modification flags are saved and restored when you save and open files, respectively. Line modification flags for the last 200 files are saved. This option works best when the language-specific View option Modified lines is enabled.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore selective display
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, Selective Display is saved and restored when saving and opening files, respectively. Selective Display for the last 200 files is saved.

Boolean.Caption: Auto restore symbol browser tree
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the symbol browser tree in the Symbols tool window is restored across edit sessions. The currently selected position is always restored regardless of this setting.

DirectoryPath.Caption: Spill file path
DirectoryPath.DialogHelp: Specifies the directory for spill and temporary files. On Windows, this defaults to the directory specified by the TEMP environment variable. If it does not exist, the directory specified by the TMP environment variable is used. On UNIX, this defaults to the directory specified by the TMP environment variable. Press Delete to clear this field, specifying the default.

Numeric.Caption: Buffer cache size (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum amount of memory, in kilobytes, used to store text buffer data. A value that is less than zero specifies all available memory.

Numeric.Caption: Tag file cache size (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the cache size, in kilobytes, for tag files. Tagging performance can be improved by adjusting this setting to better match the size of your tag files. Generally, a tag file cache size that matches the total size of the tag files being used will provide the best performance. Note: This is the same as the Tag File Cache Size option under Tools > Options > Editing > Context Tagging®.

Numeric.Caption: Tag file cache maximum (KB)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies the maximum cache size, in kilobytes, for tag files. The tag file cache size can be dynamically adjusted as high as this amount depending on the amount of available memory on your machine at the time SlickEdit is started.

Select.Caption: Save configuration
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies whether or not a confirmation prompt is displayed when configuration changes to SlickEdit are saved. If set to Save configuration immediately, configuration changes will be saved immediately after changes are detected.

Boolean.Caption: Exit confirmation prompt
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit always displays a confirmation prompt prior to exiting the application.

Dialog.Caption: Notifications
Dialog.DialogHelp: SlickEdit has many helpful features that assist you while editing to improve efficiency and productivity. However, since these features often alter text while you type, users unfamiliar with the feature may be surprised or confused. To inform you when a feature has made a change in your file, a notification is displayed. The Notification Options will help you to understand and customize editing features, as well as which notifications are displayed for each one.
Dialog.Tags: notification levels background processes turn notifications method log tool window scans determine which styles current these settings then used so your new code will match existing coding file options adaptive formatting feature hide icon disable all pop ups

Dialog.Caption: Product Improvement Program
Dialog.DialogHelp: The Product Improvement Program collects data to improve the overall SlickEdit experience.
Dialog.Tags: product improvement program participate collects data you application usage then sent back slickedit we may able determine how best user experience all completely anonymous will not machine workspace names send any source code does gather information file project types tool windows used options settings

Boolean.Caption: Participate in the Product Improvement Program
Boolean.DialogHelp: The Product Improvement Program collects anonymous data to improve the overall SlickEdit experience. Set this value to On to participate in the Product Improvement Program.

Category.Caption: Network & Internet Options
Category.DialogHelp: Use Network and Internet Options to configure the IP setting, FTP connection profiles and options, proxy settings, and more.

Select.Caption: Internet protocol (IP)
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies the IP (Internet Protocol) version for SlickEdit to use when connecting to a host. This setting applies to the FTP, SFTP, and Open URL features.

Dialog.Caption: FTP Default Options
Dialog.DialogHelp: FTP options include the ability to set the default local directory, specify preferences such as the default timeout and port information, enable firewall/proxy support, and configure SSH information.
Dialog.Tags: ftp options timestamps $list general anonymous email address default local not without prompting resolve links advanced timeout sec keep alive upload filename preserve lowercase force uppercase enable firewall host port id password type open usersite after logon router passive transfers pasv slickedit verbose events say window ftplog entries raw directory listing save debug vsproxylog sftp executable example cygwin bin sshexe subsystem service

Dialog.Caption: URL Mappings
Dialog.DialogHelp: This feature lets you map a URL path or file to a local or remote path or file, so you can work offline or from a test location that contains DTDs referenced by your XML files. In the From field, enter the URL you want to map. In the To field, enter the location to use for this URL.
Dialog.Tags: url mappings use dialog local remote path allows off line work test location which contains dtds your xml files reference default search directory

Dialog.Caption: URI Schemes
Dialog.DialogHelp: Enable Ctrl+click URL navigation for the URI schemes specified.
Dialog.Tags: uri schemes url support add delete

Dialog.Caption: Proxy Settings
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options allow you to configure a proxy server to use when SlickEdit needs to use an Internet connection. Internet Explorer settings are used by default.
Dialog.Tags: proxy settings none internet explorer servers type port http exceptions do not for addresses beginning use semicolons separate entries

Dialog.Caption: Web Browser Setup
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use these options to specify the browser to use when SlickEdit needs to launch one. Selecting a preferred browser automatically sets the defaults for the other options on this form.
Dialog.Tags: web browser setup browsers automatic internet explorer chrome other mozilla safari firefox program application topic item use dde parse parts buffer name defaults

Category.Caption: Tools
Category.DialogHelp: These settings pertain to third-party tools supported by SlickEdit, such as Microsoft Visual Studio projects and version control (CVS, Subversion, etc.).

Text.Caption: Common list
Text.DialogHelp: Specifies the default dictionary. The default dictionary list is named scommon.lst and is located in the SlickEdit installation directory.

Text.Caption: User list 1
Text.DialogHelp: You can have up to two custom dictionaries. When a word is not found during a spell check and you add the word to User list 1 or 2, the word is added to the associated file specified in these fields. By default, the first time words are added, SlickEdit creates files named userdct1.lst and userdct2.lst in your config directory, so these file names are filled in for you. If you choose to create your own files, be sure to place them in the default config directory and add the file names here.

Text.Caption: User list 2
Text.DialogHelp: You can have up to two custom dictionaries. When a word is not found during a spell check and you add the word to User list 1 or 2, the word is added to the associated file specified in these fields. By default, the first time words are added, SlickEdit creates files named userdct1.lst and userdct2.lst in your config directory, so these file names are filled in for you. If you choose to create your own files, be sure to place them in the default config directory and add the file names here.

Boolean.Caption: Ignore all UPPERCASE words
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, all words in uppercase are ignored during a spell check operation. This applies to all spell check operations.

Boolean.Caption: Detect repeated words
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, words that are repeated twice in a row are detected during a spell check operation. This applies to all spell check operations.

Category.Caption: Version Control
Category.DialogHelp: SlickEdit integrates seamlessly with many version control providers. Version control actions are readily available from the Tools > Version Control menu or by right-clicking within a file or a buffer. Use Version Control options to configure your version control provider for your workspace and to define the behavior of SlickEdit when using Version Control.

Dialog.Caption: Version Control Setup
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use these settings to enable version control support and to specify configuration information and preferences.
Dialog.Tags: version control setup source command line systems vcs add delete rename copy scc providers initialize advanced open project none auto out edit read only check prompt for files

FilePath.Caption: CVS executable
FilePath.DialogHelp: Specifies the path to the CVS executable that you wish to use.

Boolean.Caption: Always pass CVSROOT to CVS commands (use cvs -d option)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the CVS -d option is passed to all CVS commands.

Boolean.Caption: Use CVS status for file bitmaps on project tool window
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the current CVS status is used to show icons on the project tool window.

Boolean.Caption: When updating, move to next file after diff
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, after the diff of one file is complete, the next file will be shown.

Boolean.Caption: When committing, restore last comment
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the last comment used to commit a file is restored for possible reuse.

Boolean.Caption: When committing, restore last tag(s)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the last tag used to commit a file is restored for possible reuse.

Boolean.Caption: Show labels in version history tree
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the version history tree will show labels.

Boolean.Caption: In GUI update hide folders missing in repository
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, empty local directories in the update tree will be hidden.

FilePath.Caption: Git executable
FilePath.DialogHelp: Specifies the path to the Git executable that you wish to use.

Boolean.Caption: Push/Pull is interactive
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the command window will be shown for Push and Pull operations to allow entering a pass phrase.

FilePath.Caption: Mercurial executable
FilePath.DialogHelp: Specifies the path to the Mercurial executable that you wish to use.

Boolean.Caption: Push/Pull is interactive
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the command window will be shown for Push and Pull operations to allow answering prompts

FilePath.Caption: Subversion executable
FilePath.DialogHelp: Specifies the path to the Subversion executable that you wish to use.

Boolean.Caption: When updating, move to next file after diff
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, after the diff of one file is complete, the next file will be shown.

Boolean.Caption: When committing, restore last comment
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the last comment used to commit a file is restored for possible reuse.

Boolean.Caption: Show branches in version history tree
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the version history tree will show branches.

Boolean.Caption: Traverse parent branch history
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the version history tree will traverse parent branches. When set to off, use Subversion's --stop-on-copy option.

Condition.Option: Show branches in version history tree

Boolean.Caption: Show labels in version history tree
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the version history tree will show labels.

Boolean.Caption: Hide empty branches in version history tree
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the version history tree will hide empty branches

Boolean.Caption: Show status on file icons
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, dialogs that display file icons in the tree will show the file's Subversion status

Numeric.Caption: Get updates from Subversion every (m)
Numeric.DialogHelp: Specifies how often Subversion should be queried for updated file status information.

Dialog.Caption: Configure Error Parsing
Dialog.DialogHelp: SlickEdit uses these regular expressions (in the SlickEdit syntax) to parse the contents of the Build window and retrieve the file name or path, line number, column number, and error message. Use/edit the defaults or write your own regular expressions. Check/uncheck the boxes to enable/disable entire categories or individual expressions. Use the arrows to set the priority of categories and individual expressions.
Dialog.Tags: error regular expressions category name categories reset

Category.Caption: Help Options
Category.DialogHelp: These settings pertain to the SlickEdit Help system.

Text.Caption: Word help filename(s)
Text.DialogHelp: Specifies the Word Help files (.idx or .mvb) used by the wh command (Ctrl+F1), wh2 command (Ctrl+F2), and wh3 command. Separate each file with a plus sign. You can only specify one IDX or MVB file per command.

Boolean.Caption: Use MSDN help for F1 help
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, enables use of an MSDN Help Collection as the default help.

Select.Caption: MSDN help collection
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies which MSDN Help collection to use as the default Help.

Condition.Option: Use MSDN help for F1 help

Dialog.Caption: F1 Index File
Dialog.DialogHelp: These options are used to build and manage the Help files for Help searches and lookup.
Dialog.Tags: configure help index file files edit export path load scan more default show keywords

Category.Caption: Additional Options
Category.DialogHelp: Though these options are not accessible through the Tools > Options dialog, they are still available for export and import operations.

Dialog.Caption: Menu Customizations
Dialog.DialogHelp: You can customize existing menus by adding, removing, or modifying menu items.

Dialog.Caption: Toolbar Customizations
Dialog.DialogHelp: You can customize existing toolbars by adding, removing, or modifying buttons.

Dialog.Caption: Toolbar and Tool Window Layout
Dialog.DialogHelp: You can customize the layout of toolbars and tool windows.

Dialog.Caption: User-Created Toolbars
Dialog.DialogHelp: You can create new toolbars and then customize them by adding, removing, or modifying buttons.

Dialog.Caption: User-Recorded Macros
Dialog.DialogHelp: You can automate repetitive tasks by recording a series of SlickEdit operations in a macro. After you create the macro, you can run it, save it, or bind it to a key sequence.

Dialog.Caption: XML/HTML Formatting
Dialog.DialogHelp: Content in XML and HTML (and other similar languages) may be set to automatically wrap and format as you edit. XML/HTML Formatting is essentially comprised of two features: Content Wrap, which wraps the contents between tags, and Tag Layout, which formats tags according to a specified layout.

Dialog.Caption: Code Templates
Dialog.DialogHelp: Code templates are pre-defined units of code that you can use to automate the creation of common code elements, like a standard class implementation or design patterns. Templates can contain substitution parameters that are replaced when a new element is created from that template.

Dialog.Caption: Project Types
Dialog.DialogHelp: Project templates are pre-defined project types that you can use to create new projects with pre-defined build tools, include directories, and compiler properties.

Dialog.Caption: Options History
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use this page to see changed options. From the drop-down, select Anytime to see all options that have been changed from the default values since the editor was installed or choose another time period. Only the most recent date is shown for options that have been changed more than once. The number of results is displayed at the top right of the window. Double-click on an option to display that options page in the dialog.
Dialog.Tags: recently changed options path date method results found

Dialog.Caption: Preferences History
Dialog.DialogHelp: Use this page to see changed preferences. From the drop-down, select Anytime to see all preferences that have been changed from the default values since the editor was installed or choose another time period. Only the most recent date is shown for preferences that have been changed more than once. The number of results is displayed at the top right of the window. Double-click on a preference to display that preferences page in the dialog.
Dialog.Tags: recently changed options path date method results found

Dialog.Caption: Export/Import Options
Dialog.DialogHelp: Allows the export and import of all or selected SlickEdit settings.
Dialog.Tags: export/import options setup exporting way share your slickedit groups want all other users also restore backed earlier using feature once pick package can preview settings within choose which ones

Dialog.Caption: Export/Import Preferences
Dialog.DialogHelp: Allows the export and import of all or selected SlickEdit settings.
Dialog.Tags: export/import options setup exporting way share your slickedit groups want all other users also restore backed earlier using feature once pick package can preview settings within choose which ones

Dialog.Caption: Search Results
Dialog.DialogHelp: This page displays detailed results from searching the Options tree. The number of results is displayed at the top right of the window. Double-click on an option to display that options page in the dialog. To reset the tree and clear the search box, click the Clear button next to the Search box at the top of the Options dialog.
Dialog.Tags: options search results path found

Boolean.Caption: First line is top
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, the first line of the text selection is used as the first line of the comment. The top border is not drawn. When set to Off, the open comment characters will appear on their own line.

Boolean.Caption: Last line is bottom
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, the last line of the text selection is used as the last line of the comment. The bottom border is not drawn. When set to Off, the open comment characters appear on their own line.

Text.Caption: Top left corner
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used in the top left corner of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Top side
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the top horizontal side of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Top right corner
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used in the top right corner of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Left side
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the left vertical side of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Right side
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the right vertical side of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Bottom left corner
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used in the bottom left corner of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Bottom side
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the bottom horizontal side of the comment block.

Text.Caption: Bottom right corner
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used in the bottom right corner of the comment block.

Boolean.Caption: Automatically close block comments
Boolean.DialogHelp: Enables automatic completion of C-style comment block start and end markers.

Text.Caption: Left
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the left side of the commented line.

Text.Caption: Right
Text.DialogHelp: This option specifies the comment characters used on the right side of the commented line.

Select.Caption: Location
Select.DialogHelp: This option controls where characters specified in the Left line comment box are placed. When "At left margin" is selected, then left comment characters are placed flush against the left margin of the editor window. The indent levels are not changed. When "At level of indent", left comment line characters are placed and aligned at the current indent level. When "Start in column" is selected, then the left line comment characters are placed in a column you specify.

Numeric.Caption: Start in column
Numeric.DialogHelp: When Location is set to "Start in column", use this option to specify the column where the left comment line characters should be placed.

Boolean.Caption: Automatically expand doc comments
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, then a skeleton doc comment is automatically inserted when you type comment start characters and then press Enter on a line directly above a function, class, or variable.

Boolean.Caption: Extend leading border
Boolean.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, then leading asterisks are inserted at the beginning of each line in the comment.

Boolean.Caption: Split line comments
Boolean.DialogHelp: If set to On, when you press Enter in the middle of a line comment, a new line comment will automatically be started on the new line.

Boolean.Caption: Extend line comments
Boolean.DialogHelp: If set to On, when you press Enter at the end of a line containing a line comment, and there is also an aligned line comment on the line before or after the current line, a new line comment will automatically be started on the new line.

Boolean.Caption: Join comments with joining lines
Boolean.DialogHelp: If set to On, when you press Delete at the end of a line containing a line comment to join the current line with the next line, and the next line is also a line comment, the line comment characters will automatically be deleted.

Boolean.Caption: Split strings on enter
Boolean.DialogHelp: If set to On, when you press Enter to split a line when the cursor is inside of a string, the closing and opening quotes and, if necessary, operators, will automatically be inserted, and the string will be aligned with the original string.

Boolean.Caption: Write comment to file
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the comment is written to a temporary file, the name of which can be parsed into the command line by putting in "%c" When set to Off and "%c" is in the command line, the comment can only be one line and "%c" will be replaced by the comment itself.

Boolean.Caption: UNIX comment file
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, writes the comment file with UNIX end-of-line characters.

Boolean.Caption: Run "dosrc" to get error code
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit will run "dosrc" to get any error codes.

Boolean.Caption: Add *.??v to File Type list (PVCS)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, adds the archive file name (*.??v) to the file type list.

Boolean.Caption: Require VCS Project box to be filled in
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, the VCS Project text box on the Version Control Setup dialog is required to be filled in.

Boolean.Caption: Always show output
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, output from the version control system is shown regardless of the return code.

Boolean.Caption: CD to file's directory before running VCS command
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, SlickEdit will temporarily change the current directory to the path of the file being operated on while running the command. The directory is changed back after the command is finished.

Select.Caption: VCS Project
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies VCS Project behavior.

NotCondition.Value: This directory contains the archive files (RCS)

Choice.Caption: CD to this directory before running VCS command
This directory contains the archive files (RCS)

Select.Caption: Error capture
Select.DialogHelp: Specifies how error output from the version control system should be captured.

Choice.Caption: Capture errors from stdout and stderr

Boolean.Caption: Simulate return code (Search output for "Error")(Delta)
Boolean.DialogHelp: When set to On, then SlickEdit displays output from the version control system if either of the words "error" or "warning" is found.

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_general
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Use this page to set various general language-specific options and to see the file extensions associated with the language. The settings on this page depend on the selected language.
DialogTemplate.Tags: general mode extensions map extensionless files referenced names edit these languages truncation length context menus no selection use smartpaste auto caps insert real backspace beginning bounds off start tab key reindents line never always leading blanks strict end pairs word chars style specific project

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_view
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: These options control the display of special characters and line numbers, and let you enable Hex Mode Editing on a language-specific basis. All of these options can be toggled on/off individually on a per-document basis using the View menu items.
DialogTemplate.Tags: view tabs spaces newline special characters numbers minimum width use bold for names definitions declarations highlight unidentified symbols lookup configure coloring rules modified lines current select hex

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_adaptive_formatting
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Adaptive Formatting scans a file for the formatting styles in use, and automatically matches those settings for the current editing session. This page lets you enable Adaptive Formatting and specify which formatting styles to scan for.
DialogTemplate.Tags: _language_adaptive_formatting_form casing brace use syntax tabs keyword tags attributes inserted single hex values indent case switch no space before parenthesis padding between parentheses begin end style

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_formatting
DialogTemplate.Tags: formatting *ALL_LANGUAGES* syntax tabs adaptive keyword none begin end if style immediately blank braces quick unbrace statements place else same line tags attributes inserted single capitalize hex values uppercase lowercase options default scheme content wrapping enable layout use continuation function parameters indent switch space before parenthesis padding between parentheses auto symbol translation

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_comments
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: This page lets you control how block and line comments are created. Document > Comment Block and Document > Comment Lines use the comment style and options specified here to comment out all text on the lines containing the selection. You can also control the behavior of doc comments and comment/string editing.
DialogTemplate.Tags: comments characters first top last bottom right location left margin level indent start column expand doc expansion leading border extend joining lines editing split strings enter automatically close block affects languages

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_comment_wrap
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Comment Wrap options let you activate wrapping and configure the way block, line, and doc comments are wrapped.
DialogTemplate.Tags: comment wrap enable start wrapping automatic maximum fixed margin right preserve width existing continue bullet list enter javadoc use hanging indent block tag comments sync vertical line column

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_word_wrap
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: These language-specific options control Word Wrap, which keeps the cursor within the specified margins when entering text, moving the cursor, and deleting characters.
DialogTemplate.Tags: word wrap margins right new paragraph justify style respace after period left justified enable soft break on boundary

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_auto-complete
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Auto-Complete is a feature that offers suggestions for the automatic completion of syntax, keywords, symbols, and lines of code. These options let you enable Auto-Complete, select the items for which you want to see completion choices, and specify the behavior of the feature in general.
DialogTemplate.Tags: auto-complete enable locals class current keywords argument syntax expansion expandable dynamic surround aliases symbols members open parenthesis for functions compatible values files after typing include visual details light bulb expanded text list matches icons categories parameters declaration show comments options tab cycles through choices longest unique always inserts space use strict case sensitivity rules minimum prefix length completion preserve identifier right cursor

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_auto_bracket
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Auto-Close automatically inserts the closing punctuation for bracketed and quotation punctuation pairs, with option to automatically insert padding inside the automatically insert punctuation.
DialogTemplate.Tags: auto-close enable parenthesis angle bracket double single quote brace insert padding completion enter tab configure automatic closing block comments

DialogTemplate.Name: language_setup_context_tagging
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: These options let you configure the language-specific settings for Context Tagging, a feature set that performs expression type, scope, and inheritance analysis as well as symbol look-up within the current context to help you navigate and write code. Global tagging options are located at Tools > Options > Editing > Context Tagging®.
DialogTemplate.Tags: context tagging sensitive display information auto compatible parameters pad parentheses insert space after comma go definition prioritize navigation ignore forward class declarations rules attempt filter out non function overloads expensive slow highlighting mouse show comments matching symbols under cursor strict case sensitivity completing identifers configure list members completion

DialogTemplate.Name: alias_editor
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Aliases are identifiers that you can quickly type, which are then expanded into snippets of text. Language-specific aliases are useful for inserting comment headers, statement and function templates, or any other text that you frequently use. To create a new alias, click New and enter the identifier you want to use. Then in the alias editor box, type the substitution text, then click Apply. To use the alias in a file, type the identifier and press Ctrl+Space.
DialogTemplate.Tags: alias editor - surround new delete parameters insert escape sequence

DialogTemplate.Name: lexer_editor
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: Color Coding is a feature that displays various portions of code in color for identification purposes. Use these options to configure Color Coding for languages that support it.
DialogTemplate.Tags: color coding setup lexer tokens preprocessor punctuation lib symbols operators user defined get case sensitive characters style motorola hex octal intel assembler basenumberexponent floating point exponents not underscores integers language specific other enables model ibm hlasm progress numbers basic escapes next unix shells followed function special coloring package statements can appear anywhere identifiers may cobol unicode treat everything xa file inactive regions preprocessing comments after columns preceded ctlmessage label nesting allowed non blank check first must last used api only start delimiter documentation keywords javadoc doxygen double two consecutive quotes represents single always long trailing backslash continues search across multiple lines delay until end backquoted strings bourne names attributes values tags new delete import colors

DialogTemplate.Name: c_preprocessing
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: For performance considerations, Context Tagging® does not do full preprocessing, so macros that interfere with normal C++ syntax can cause the parser to miss symbols. To prevent this, use this page to add the necessary preprocessing macros. Arguments are allowed, for example: mymacro(a,b,c) You can add large numbers of #defines directly to the usercpp.h file located in the user config directory.

DialogTemplate.Name: version_control_commands
DialogTemplate.SystemHelp: Version Control Command Setup Dialog Box
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: This dialog allows you to specify the commands and arguments used to run Version Control commands.
DialogTemplate.Tags: version control commands add checkin checkout difference get history manager properties remove unlock

DialogTemplate.Name: _language_setup_beautifier
DialogTemplate.DialogHelp: These language-specific options let you configure the way SlickEdit formats code as you type. Depending on the language, you can specify the code formatting templates, how various syntatical elements are treated, when and what code elements are automatically inserted, and more. You can also apply these formatting settings to any file by going to Tools > Beautify.
DialogTemplate.Tags: beautifier configuration k&r code beautify reset preview load profile delete create copy edit tabs spaces indent brace style

TextTemplate.Name: LangModeName
TextTemplate.Caption: Mode name
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: Allows you to enter a more meaningful name for this language setup.

TextTemplate.Name: LangAssociatedExtensions
TextTemplate.Caption: Associated extensions
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: A list of file extensions associated with this language.

TextTemplate.Name: LangReferencedInLanguages
TextTemplate.Caption: Referenced in
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: A list of languages which may contain code which can reference symbols in this language.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangTruncation
NumericTemplate.Caption: Truncation
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: When On or Auto is selected, all editor operations prevent the data from the right of the truncation line length to be moved or modified. Set this to Auto for the editor to determine the truncation line length based on the record format of the file. For files that do not have a record format, the truncation length is turned off. The truncation line is not displayed when using proportional fonts, as in Unicode files.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAutoCaps
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto CAPS
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, and a file is opened that does not contain any lowercase characters, caps mode is turned on (not the same as caps lock). When caps mode is on, all text is inserted in uppercase. This feature is intended to emulate ISPF.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangBeautSyntax
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Beautify syntax expansions
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, syntax expansions are run through the beautifier.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangBeautAlias
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Beautify alias expansions
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, alias expansions are run through the beautifier.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangBeautEditing
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Beautify on {, }, ;, etc...
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, text will be beautified as the user types it.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangBeautPaste
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Beautify on paste or drag
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, text will be beautified when code is pasted or dropped into the buffer.

TextTemplate.Name: LangBounds
TextTemplate.Caption: Bounds
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: This setting controls column bounds for specific ISPF commands that operate on column ranges. This setting is unique to the ISPF emulation. The boundary lines are not displayed when using proportional fonts, as in Unicode files.

TextTemplate.Name: LangDiffColumns
TextTemplate.Caption: Diff columns
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: When On, diff will ignore changes outside the column range specified. This feature is designed for main frame languages like COBOL.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangMenuIfNoSelection
SelectTemplate.Caption: Menu if no selection
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: This specifies the menu that is displayed when right-clicking in an edit window that does not have a selection.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangMenuIfSelection
SelectTemplate.Caption: Menu if selection
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: This specifies the menu that is displayed when right-clicking in an edit window that has a selection.

TextTemplate.Name: LangBeginEndPairs
TextTemplate.Caption: Begin/end pairs
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: Specify the begin/end pairs to use for the selected extension in a format similar to a regular expression.

TextTemplate.Name: LangWordChars
TextTemplate.Caption: Word chars
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: These are the characters that used to recognize a string of text as a word. The word characters affect the operation of all word-oriented commands, including word searching. You can use a dash (-) character to specify a range, such as "A-Z", which specifies uppercase letters. To specify the dash (-) character as a valid word character, place a dash at the beginning or end of the word character string.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangIndentStyle
SelectTemplate.Caption: Indent style
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When None is selected, the Enter key will put the cursor at the beginning of the line. When Auto is selected, the Enter key indents according to the previous line. When Syntax Indent is selected, the Enter key indents according to language syntax. The Syntax Indent option specifies the amount to indent for each level.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangSyntaxIndent
NumericTemplate.Caption: Syntax indent
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This option specifies the amount to indent for each level when the Indent Style is set to Syntax Indent.

TextTemplate.Name: LangTabs
TextTemplate.Caption: Tabs
TextTemplate.DialogHelp: Set tabs in increments of a specific value or at specific column positions.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangIndentWithTabs
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Indent with tabs
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When On, the Tab key, Enter key, and paragraph reformat commands indent with tabs. When Off, these operations indent with spaces.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangInsertRealIndent
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Insert real indent
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is On, the Enter key inserts real spaces or tabs representing the indent instead of virtual spaces. This setting affects all extensions. This option allows the function for the End key on the keyboard to place the cursor after blank text where new text can be typed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangBackspaceAtBeginning
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Backspace at beginning of line un-indents
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is On and the cursor is located before the first non-blank character, pressing the Backspace key unindents the current line by one indent level.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangUseSmartPaste
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use SmartPaste
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Specifies whether copied or pasted text should be reindented according to what the editor thinks is the correct indent level.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangWhenTabKeyReindents
SelectTemplate.Caption: When tab key reindents the line
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: This option controls when the Tab key is used to reindent the current line. When "Never" is selected, pressing Tab will never reindent the line. It will indent to the next tab stop. When "Always" is selected, pressing the Tab key in any column will reindent the current line. When "In leading blanks" is selected, pressing the Tab key will reindent the line if the cursor is positioned within the leading white space of the line. Otherwise, it will indent to the next tab stop.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangStrict
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Strict
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is On, it reindents the line only if the cursor position is before the intended indent location; otherwise, it will insert an additional tab stop. When this option is Off, it reindents the line when the cursor is located on the leading whitespace, regardless of whether the column is before or after the intended indent location.

Condition.Option: When tab key reindents the line

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangViewSpecialCharacters
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Special Characters
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: This option enables display of all types of special characters. This includes Tabs, Spaces, and Newline characters as well as all of the other special characters listed on the Appearance > Special Characters options screen.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangViewTabs
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Tabs
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, Tab characters are displayed using the character specified on Appearance > Special Characters.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangViewSpaces
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Spaces
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, Spaces are displayed using the character specified on Appearance > Special Characters.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangViewNewlines
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Newline characters
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, Newline characters are displayed using the character specified on Appearance > Special Characters.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLineNumbersOn
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Line numbers on
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is selected, display of line numbers is enabled for the selected language.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangLineNumbersLength
NumericTemplate.Caption: Line numbers length
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: When Fixed with line numbers are used, this is the width set aside for line numbers. When Automatic line numbers are used, this is the minimum amount of space to set aside for line numbers.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangModifiedLines
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Modified lines
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, lines that have been modified are color coded.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangCurrentLine
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Current line
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, the current line is color coded.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangHexView
SelectTemplate.Caption: Hex view
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: This option is used to enable Hex mode editing (either Hex or Line hex).

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnableSymbolColoring
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable symbol coloring
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Enable or disable symbol coloring for this language.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangUseBoldForSymbolNames
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use bold for symbol names in definitions and declarations
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, identifiers which are the name of a symbol in a definition or declaration will be highlighted in bold.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangStrictSymbolLookups
SelectTemplate.Caption: Symbol coloring
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to use strict symbol looks, expect symbol coloring to look up all symbols by name following strict language rules. When set to use relaxed symbol lookups, allow symbol coloring to look up any symbol by name without following strict language rules. When set to use simplistic symbol lookups, allow symbol coloring to look up any symbol by name only, ignoring context and language rules.

Choice.Caption: Use strict symbol lookups (full symbol analysis)
Use relaxed symbol lookups (symbol analysis with relaxed rules)
Use fast, simplistic symbol lookups (symbol name only)

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangDoNotHightlightUnidentified
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Do not highlight unidentified symbols
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, identifiers which are not found by tagging will not be colored as unknown or error symbols. This setting is recommended for languages that allow implicit declarations or dynamic typing, for example, where precise symbol analysis is made difficult due to the design of the language.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangUseAdaptiveFormatting
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use Adaptive Formatting
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then Adaptive Formatting is on for this language. When set to Off, then no Adaptive Formatting actions are performed for this language.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFSyntaxIndent
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Syntax indent
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Syntax Indent setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFTabs
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Tabs
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Tabs setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFIndentWithTabs
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Indent with tabs
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Indent with Tabs setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFKeywordCase
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Keyword case
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Keyword Case setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFCaseForInsertedTags
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Case for inserted tags
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Case for Inserted Tags setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFCaseForInsertedAttributes
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Case for inserted attributes
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Case for Inserted Attributes setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFCaseForInsertedSingleWordValues
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Case for inserted single word values
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Case for Inserted Single Word Values setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFCaseForInsertedHexValues
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Case for inserted hex values
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Case for Inserted Hex Values setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFIndentCaseFromSwitch
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Indent CASE from SWITCH
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Indent Case from Switch setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFNoSpaceBeforeParen
BooleanTemplate.Caption: No space before parenthesis
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the No Space Before Parenthesis setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFInsertPaddingBetweenParens
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Insert padding between parentheses
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Insert Padding between Parentheses setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangAFBeginEndStyle
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Begin/end style
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the Begin/End Style setting for a file is determined using Adaptive Formatting.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LanguageWordWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Word wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When On, the editor keeps the cursor within the margins when entering text, moving the cursor, and deleting characters.

NumericTemplate.Name: LanguageLeftMargin
NumericTemplate.Caption: Left margin
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This option Specifies the column number at which the left margin should begin.

NumericTemplate.Name: LanguageRightMargin
NumericTemplate.Caption: Right margin
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This option Specifies the column number at which the right margin should begin.

NumericTemplate.Name: LanguageNewParagraph
NumericTemplate.Caption: New paragraph
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This option Specifies the column number at which the new paragraph margin should begin.

SelectTemplate.Name: LanguageJustifyStyle
SelectTemplate.Caption: Justify style
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: Specifies the justification style. For left justification with respacing, select "Left and respace". For left justification while preserving existing spaces, select "Left". To have the left and right edges of the text align exactly the margins, select "Justified".

BooleanTemplate.Name: LanguageOneSpaceAfterPeriod
BooleanTemplate.Caption: One space after period
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When using the Left and Respace justification style, to have only one space after period, question mark, and exclamation point punctuation characters, set this option to On. To use two spaces after these characters, set this option to Off.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LanguageEnableSoftWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable soft wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, each line is wrapped as though a carriage return was inserted, however, the file itself is not modified. A curved arrow is displayed at the end of each line, along the right-hand border of the edit pane, indicating that the text continues on the next line. The horizontal scrollbar disappears, as it is no longer needed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LanguageBreakOnWordBoundary
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Break on word boundary
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, then the editor breaks the text at the end of the line so that words are kept whole.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnableCommentWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable comment wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, comments are allowed to be wrapped.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnableBlockCommentWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable block comment wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, block comments are allowed to be wrapped.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnableDocCommentWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable doc comment wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, doc comments are allowed to be wrapped.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnableLineCommentWrap
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable line comment wrap
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, line comments are allowed to be wrapped.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangStartWrappingOnLine
NumericTemplate.Caption: Start wrapping on line
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This setting pertains to line comments only. Specifies the number of consecutive line comments that must be present before wrapping is activated.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangCWCommentWidth
SelectTemplate.Caption: Comment width
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: Specifies the width setting for comments. When "Fixed width" is selected, comments are formatted to a specific width by maintaining the original left margin and adjusting the right margin to meet the target width. When "Automatic width" is selected, the width of the longest multi-line paragraph in the comment block is used as the width for block comments. When "Fixed right margin" is selected, lines will break before the specified number of columns has been reached.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangCWWidth
NumericTemplate.Caption: Width
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: Specifies the width of block comments when the Comment width setting is set to "Fixed width".

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangCWUseMaximumRightColumnFixed
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use maximum right column (Fixed width)
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When the Comment width is set to "Fixed with" or "Automatic width", setting this option to On allows you to specify a maximum right column where comments will be wrapped regardless of whether they have reached the fixed or automatic width.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangCWMaximumRightColumnFixed
NumericTemplate.Caption: Maximum right column (Fixed width)
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: When the Comment width is set to "Fixed with" or "Automatic width", then this value specifies the column where all comments will be wrapped even if they have not reached the specified width. When Comment width is set to "Fixed right margin", then this option specifies where comments will break.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangCWUseMaximumRightColumnAuto
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use maximum right column (Automatic width)
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When the Comment width is set to "Fixed with" or "Automatic width", setting this option to On allows you to specify a maximum right column where comments will be wrapped regardless of whether they have reached the fixed or automatic width.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangCWMaximumRightColumnAuto
NumericTemplate.Caption: Maximum right column (Automatic width)
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: When the Comment width is set to "Fixed with" or "Automatic width", then this value specifies the column where all comments will be wrapped even if they have not reached the specified width. When Comment width is set to "Fixed right margin", then this option specifies where comments will break.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangCWRightColumn
NumericTemplate.Caption: Right column
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: When the Comment width is set to "Fixed with" or "Automatic width", then this value specifies the column where all comments will be wrapped even if they have not reached the specified width. When Comment width is set to "Fixed right margin", then this option specifies where comments will break.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangCWPreserveWidth
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Preserve width on existing comments
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, when editing an existing comment, the editor preserves the width of the existing comment. The width is determined by the length of the longest multi-line paragraph. If the width of the existing comment cannot be determined, the formatting option specified under Comment width will be used instead.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangCWContinueBulletList
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Continue bullet list on ENTER
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, when Enter is pressed inside a bulleted paragraph, a new bullet will be inserted and the cursor will be placed at the text starting position.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangUseHangingIndent
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use hanging indent on block tag comments
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the second line of a block tag comment will be automatically aligned to the first non-whitespace character after the first word after the tag.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACEnableAutoCompletion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enable auto-completion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, this option activates the Auto-Complete feature.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACSyntaxExpansion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Syntax expansion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, Auto-Complete will show Syntax Expansion choices for the word prefix under the cursor.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACKeywords
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Keywords
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, Auto-Complete will show keyword choices for the word prefix under the cursor, if it matches one or more keywords in the current language.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACAliasExpansion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Alias expansion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, Auto-Complete will show the matching alias for the word under the cursor. Alias names require an exact word match, not just a prefix match.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACSymbols
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Symbols
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, symbols will be displayed as completion options if the word prefix at the cursor matches one or more symbols using a strict, context-sensitive and language-specific tag search.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACLocals
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Locals
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, local variables will be displayed as a separate completion category from the general category for Symbols.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACMembers
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Current class
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, members of the current class or package will be displayed as a separate completion category from the general category for Symbols.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACCurrentFile
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Current file
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, symbols from the current file will be displayed as a separate completion category from the general category for Symbols.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACWordCompletion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Word completion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, word completions will be displayed if the word prefix under the cursor matches one or more words in the current file.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangACPoundInclude
SelectTemplate.Caption: List include files after typing #include
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: Determines whether to attempt to list possible files after typing #include.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangACArgumentCompletion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Argument completion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, turns Auto-Complete on in the Build tool window for completing file names and paths.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangTabInsertsLongestUnique
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Tab inserts longest unique prefix
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, pressing Tab will cause Auto-Complete to attempt to insert the longest unique prefix match of all its completions. If the word prefix cannot be extended, Tab will cycle to the next completion choices.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangTabCyclesThroughChoices
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Tab cycles through choices
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Set this option to On if you want to use Tab and Shift+Tab to cycle through completion choices, as is done in some command shells. If set to Off, Tab will attempt to insert the longest unique prefix (if selected), or insert the selected completion, or cancel Auto-Complete and behave normally if there is no completion selected.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangEnterAlwaysInserts
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Enter always inserts current item
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Set this option to On if you want Enter to only insert if you have selected an item in Auto-Complete. If set to Off, Enter will cancel Auto-Complete if there is no item currently selected.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangMinimumPrefixLength
NumericTemplate.Caption: Minimum prefix length
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: This option specifies the minimum number of characters the word prefix must contain before auto-completions will be displayed automatically.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowLightBulb
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show light bulb
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the editor displays the light bulb as a reminder when Auto-Complete suggestions are available for the current word prefix.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowExpandedText
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show expanded text
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the editor displays the rest of the word or statement being completed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowListOfMatches
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show list of matches
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the editor displays the list of matches underneath the word prefix.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowIcons
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show icons
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the editor displays symbol icons and folder icons. Set this option to Off to get a more compact list containing only completions.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowCategories
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show categories
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the editor show completions in a categorized list for each type. If set to Off, all completions will be shown in one flat, sorted list.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowParameters
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show parameters
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If selected, shows the function parameter signatures for symbol completions.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowSymbolDeclaration
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show symbol declaration
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, for symbol completions, the editor wills how the symbol declaration as a comment to the right of the symbol completion.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowComments
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show comments
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, for symbol completions, the editor will display the symbols' comments to the right of the symbol completion.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangShowPrototypes
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Prototypes
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, for symbol completions, the editor will display the symbols' function argument list along with the function name in the drop down list when there are a small number of functions to display, or specifically for the symbol under the cursor.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangSyntaxExpansion
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Syntax expansion
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is On, pressing the spacebar after typing a keyword such as IF or FOR will cause that syntax element to be expanded, inserting the rest of the statement.

NumericTemplate.Name: LangMinimumExpandable
NumericTemplate.Caption: Minimum expandable keyword length
NumericTemplate.DialogHelp: Sets the minimum length for a keyword that will trigger Syntax Expansion.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangUseDynamicSurround
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use Dynamic Surround
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Provides the ability to surround a group of statements with a block statement, indented to the correct levels according to your indent settings.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangExpandAliasOnSpace
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Expand Aliases on space
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is On, pressing the spacebar after typing the name of a language-specific alias will cause that alias to be expanded, inserting the rest of the statement.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMAutoListMembers
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto-list members
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, typing a member access operator (for example, "." or "->" in C++) will trigger a display of a list of the members for the corresponding type.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMCompletionOnSpace
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Space always inserts space
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, pressing the spacebar when List Members is displayed will insert the longest unique matching prefix from the symbols in the list. If this option is set to Off, use Ctrl+Space when List Members is displayed to perform completion.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMSpaceAlwaysInsertsSpace
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Space always inserts space
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, pressing the spacebar when List Members is displayed will insert the current item and a space in the list after the current item. If this option is set to Off, pressing the spacebar will only insert the current item with no extra space.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMInsertOpenParens
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Insert open parenthesis
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, selecting an item in the list inserts the current item in the list and any extra characters that are required by the symbol.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangLMPreserveIdentifier
SelectTemplate.Caption: Preserve identifier to the right of cursor
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When "Preserve identifier" is selected, only the identifier characters before the cursor are replaced with an item selected from a List Members dialog. Identifier characters after the cursor are preserved. When "Replace identifiers" is selected, identifier characters following the cursor are replaced with the item selected from a list members dialog. When "Preserve identifier for auto list members only" is selected, trailing identifier characters are preserved for auto list members but not when listing members on demand by pressing Alt+Dot.

Choice.Caption: Preserve for auto list members only

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMAutoListCompatible
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto-list compatible values
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, compatible variables are automatically listed after you press the spacebar after assignment operators and return statements. Global (non-module) variables are not listed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMUseStrictCaseSensitivity
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use strict case-sensitivity rules
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: Set to On to force List Members to use strict case-sensitivity rules.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMAutoDisplayParamInfo
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto-display parameter information
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the prototype and comments for a function are automatically displayed when a function operator such as the open parenthesis is typed, and the current argument is highlighted within the displayed prototype.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMShowComments
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show comments
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, comments are displayed when Parameter Info is displayed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMAutoInsertMatchingParam
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto-insert matching parameter
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, when Parameter Info is displayed and the name of the current formal parameter matches the name of a symbol in the current scope of the appropriate type or class, the name is automatically inserted. When the name is inserted, it is also selected so that you can type over it, or you can type Comma, Space, Tab, or a closing parenthesis to use the automatically inserted parameter.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMAutoListCompatibleParams
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Auto-list compatible parameters
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, compatible variables are automatically listed when parameter info is active and typing the arguments to a function call. Global (non-module) variables are not listed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMPadParens
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Pad parentheses
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, a space is inserted after the open parenthesis when a parameter name is automatically inserted. In addition, if you type a close parenthesis after an automatically inserted parameter, it will insert a space before the close parenthesis.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangPMInsertSpaceAfterComma
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Insert space after comma
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, a space is inserted after the comma when a parameter name is automatically inserted.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangGTDGoToDefinition
SelectTemplate.Caption: Prioritize navigation to
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: Determines the behavior that occurs when the Go to Definition feature is used. To always navigate to the symbol definition or symbol declaration, select the corresponding option. The editor will follow this behavior, provided the definition or declaration is unique. You can always select to be prompted each time.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangGTDIgnoreForwardClassDeclarations
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Ignore forward class declarations
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When this option is set to On, Go to Definition filters out forward class declarations, and only shows the actual class definitions and declarations.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangGTDUseStrictCaseSensitivity
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use strict case-sensitivity rules
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, Go to Definition and Go To Declaration operate on strict case-sensitivity rules.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangGTDAttemptToFilterNonMatching
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Attempt to filter out non-matching function overloads (expensive and slow)
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, non-matching function overloads are filtered out. This affects performance.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangHCShowInfoForSymbol
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show info for symbol under mouse
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, as the mouse cursor floats over a symbol, the information and comments for that symbol are displayed.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLMShowComments
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Show comments
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: If set to On, the comments are displayed for the symbol under the mouse.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangHCHighlightMatchingSymbols
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Highlight matching symbols under cursor
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, all occurrences of the current symbol under the cursor in the buffer are highlighted. The highlight color is controlled by the Symbol Highlight screen element (Tools > Options > Appearance > Color).

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangHCUseStrictCaseSensitivity
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Use strict case-sensitivity when completing identifiers
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, strict case-sensitivity rules are followed when completing identifiers.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangLOLoadAsBinary
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Load as Binary
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, files are loaded without any translations (like changing tabs to spaces). This setting has precedence over all global options, as well as all language-specific options.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangLOExpandTabsToSpaces
SelectTemplate.Caption: Expand tabs to spaces
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, the entire contents of files are read into memory and tabs are expanded into spaces for this language. When set to Default, then the value of Tools > Options > File Options > Load > Expand tabs to spaces is used.

BooleanTemplate.Name: LangSOLoadAsBinary
BooleanTemplate.Caption: Save as Binary
BooleanTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, files are saved without any translations, exactly byte-for-byte as they appear in the buffer. This setting has precedence over all global options, as well as all language-specific options.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangSOExpandTabsToSpaces
SelectTemplate.Caption: Expand tabs to spaces
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to On, tabs are expanded to spaces according to the tab stops when the buffer is saved for this language. When set to Default, then the value of Tools > Options > File Options > Save > Expand tabs to spaces is used.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangSOStripTrailing
SelectTemplate.Caption: Strip trailing spaces
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: When set to True, trailing spaces at the end lines are stripped when the buffer is saved for this language. When set to Default, then the value of Tools > Options > File Options > Save > Strip trailing spaces is used.

Choice.Caption: Strip trailing spaces only from modified lines

SelectTemplate.Name: LangSOSEOLFormat
SelectTemplate.Caption: Line format
SelectTemplate.DialogHelp: Specifies how end of line characters are translated when a file is saved. Automatically attempts to determine the context.

SelectTemplate.Name: LangKeywordCase
